Reviews.Title: “AN EXPERIENCE!”
Reviews.Author: allypal7
Reviews.Content: Have just returned after a 4 night stay at the Soho Grand. It is quite unusual and you will either love it or find it annoying. It is very hip - with the staff usually young and trendy - but very helpful. They sorted out our problem with only two rooms booked for 7 of us! A mix-up between them and Trailfinders - who we had booked through. Barbara - a lovely lady was so good and kept everyone calm and sorted it all out, got us our rooms and paid for our snacks and drinks we had while waiting for everything to be sorted out. It is VERY expensive - especially anything from the mini-bar = 1 x small bottle of water was $5 !! We found a shop just over the road and bought water and tinned drinks there. Breakfast was a busy time and you could be left waiting for things to arrive for 10 + mins - so your pot of tea often arrived after you had finished eating. The food was lovely = our room - which was a suite on 16th floor was outstanding. The lifts took a bit of getting used to - you could only go up in the lift to as far as your room floor number - i.e. We could stop at any floor - as our room was on the 16th floor - but other family members on 9th, 10th and 12th floors could not get up to our floor. The decor is fun and wacky but the lighting is very dark and could be a little oppressive - the curtains were closed all day and night in the lounge area and the lighting changed accordingly. All in all we really enjoyed our stay - yes the traffic noise is present - particularly the use of car horns - and the air conditioning was quite loud - but effective - and you could always turn it off. I would certainly return there and it's location is perfect for sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Downtown Chic”
Reviews.Author: MintChip17
Reviews.Content: Just enjoyed four fantastic nights here with my 16 year old daughter and we can't wait to stay here again on our next visit. I don't understand some of the recent negative reviews as we had a great experience on all levels - the entire staff couldn't have been nicer or more friendly, the hotel itself is beautifully outfitted with a very cool, retro, downtown chic decor and the room was spacious, comfortable and very nicely appointed. The concierge members here were some of the best in the business, so helpful with restaurant reservations and assisting with all of our inquiries. The doormen and especially everyone at the front desk were super friendly and welcoming. Special thanks go to Rina with reservations who helped make our stay a most memorable and fantastic experience. She couldn't have been nicer or more helpful. Our corner room on the 15th floor was super quiet with stunning views of the city and more than enough room and closet space for two. The bed was incredibly comfortable and the bathroom nicely appointed and tiled. We loved the decor of the lobby lounge areas - so comfortable and a nice way to start our days with the continental breakfast that serves probably the best croissants we've ever tasted. The only negative I can say was that the breakfast service was too slow. But other than that, we had a top notch experience. Also, I normally stay in midtown but i wanted my daughter to experience the fun and excitement of staying in the heart Soho with all its great restaurants and shops, plus we wanted to be walking distance to the Village. We couldn't have been happier with our choice of hotels as it offered us that great downtown experience with all the luxuries of a top NYC hotel. I will most definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: Dave D
Reviews.Content: Outstanding service. On all levels, staff could not have been nicer or more helpful. From the moment we arrived to the time we left and the doorman found us the best cabbie in New York City, everyone at this hotel made sure we had a great visit. Our room on the 12th floor was comfortable, spotlessly clean and had a fantastic view looking uptown. The window shades were thick so we could sleep late, and the walls must have had super soundproofing because we could not hear anything in the rooms on either side of us during our entire stay, despite the fact that the hotel was fully booked. We will definitely come back here.

Reviews.Title: “Not good”
Reviews.Author: Kim4you
Reviews.Content: Okay, I've always loved this hotel.. But... The staff in the bar area were SO RUDE..... During the day and at night. And soooo slow.... Way too much attitude. And secondly, although my mistake for not checking for bed bugs..... I did however leave this hotel with red itchy bites all over my hands and arms.. Not good... I would hope it was not bed bugs, but after a week...and a physicians opinion, it seems to be so. :(

Reviews.Title: “Poor showing”
Reviews.Author: P R
Reviews.Content: We parked our car with the Soho Grand valets service. 2 mornings later I called for the car and we jumped right in and were on our way home. Upon arriving home I noticed a dent and large scrape on the back passenger side and immediately called the SoHo Grand management. They put me in touch with the valet serice Quikpark who takes no responsibility. I speak to the SoHo again and they put me off for months until they finally tell me that they are not responsible. Not only did I pay $1,100 a night for a room, but got stuck with a $1,400 damage bill. They take no responsibilty and the GM will not even get on the phone with me. Very poor showing and I feel it speaks volumes about the culture of the SoHo Grand.

Reviews.Title: “Very slow staff”
Reviews.Author: steven l
Reviews.Content: Just stayed on business, good location and has a unique retro style BUT was let down massively by the shambolic restaurant team. Ordering food/drinks at any time was painfully slow, no one took charge and we spent most of the time trying to get someones attention. Also eating food on low coffee tables isn't ideal, snacks maybe but not restaurant food. Room was on the small side and air conditioning was not responsive.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service. Ask for Helen Chiang.”
Reviews.Author: lmb1989
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location. Walking distance from great food and shop. The rooms are small NY like but tasteful and comfortable. The people at the front desk are amazing with special mention to the charming, patient and accommodating HELEN CHIANG!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jeff Z
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice hotel, conveniently located so that I could walk to the southern tip of Manhattan and to Times Square. It's located in a quiet area with several good restaurants nearby. The room was very clean and the staff were all quite friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Totally fine but need some TLC”
Reviews.Author: HotPantsMalone
Reviews.Content: The service and location is lovely, but the rooms need some refreshing at this point. Bonus for nice big bathrooms, but the bedrooms could be at any Hilton in the world. NYC has a lot of hotels and I think the Soho Grand could use some sprucing by this point, That being said, the service is great, and every floor has free coffee, so it's nice for business. I'd happily stay at the Soho Grand again, and you won't be unhappy there, but you won't be getting the very highest of the high end of NYC hotels here anymore. The James, a stone's throw away, is probably nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: HC45
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in New York many times, at various hotels, but this was the first visit to the Soho Grand. We liked the hotel overall, but there were also a couple of negatives. Good points: - Great location downtown - easy to get to most things we wanted to do. - Public areas are lovely, including a cool bar that's also really comfortable to relax in, and we really liked the music they played. - The room was nicely decorated, with a comfy bed and good bathroom amenities. - Staff were friendly and helpful in the main. - Continental breakfast included in the room rate was nice (although it was repetitive having exactly the same pastries every morning - varying them would be good). Areas for improvement: - Our room was very hot. No matter what we set the aircon at, it didn't work and the temperature never fell below 26C. In the end we gave up and left it off. We left the windows open when out, but when we closed them the room quickly heated up again. We didn't sleep very well because of the heat, and didn't want to open the windows onto the noisy street. This was February, so would have doubts about staying in summer! - Our room was paid for in advance, and we had a voucher confirming this, but at check-in there was no record of our reservation on the hotel system. This was sorted out quite efficiently, so we were fine with it. At check-out, though, we were billed again for the room. This was rectified again, but it all just seems a bit inefficient for a hotel of this standard. I'd consider staying here again in future, but it probably wouldn't be my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Meghan G
Reviews.Content: I have stayed several times at the Soho Grand, both for business and for pleasure. It has become my home away from home in NYC. The staff is, to a person, warm and professional, and they always make me feel like am the only guest in the hotel, even when they are at their busiest. Although the hotel is upscale, there is a down-to-earth vibe that makes it an incredibly relaxing place to stay even in the midst of busy Soho. When I have had minor problems (TV not working, a mix-up with room service), the issues have been addressed and fixed quickly and with a genuine smile. The staff of this hotel clearly understand what it is to be in the hospitality business. I will return again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby chic”
Reviews.Author: ronnie63_11
Reviews.Content: Trendy hotel with young clientele. Even though we were given an upgraded room upon arrival, our room was smallish with shabby furniture . It was very hot! Even when we turned off the heat and kept the windows open (in the middle of winter), it was warm.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel. Great location. Great staff!!”
Reviews.Author: yaz3005
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Soho Grand for 4 nights. The rooms were spacious and VERY clean. The staff couldn't be more helpful. The were helpful and suggested places to visit or eat.. I also recommend the food. I had a great Lobster bisque!! A great hotel with great staff.. I highly highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in NYC”
Reviews.Author: SusieLK
Reviews.Content: We made last minute plans to spend our long (President's Day) weekend. We shopped around for deals and finally decided to make reservations at the SoHo Grand. We loved the hotel and the courteous and professional staff, specially the reservation agent, Reena, made our 4 night stay so much special and memorable. We love the interior ambiance and finish, the rooms are excellent and so is the lounge, the bar, and the club-room which has a cozy fireplace. We couldn't have asked for a better location - top notch food/restaurants and shopping. We also found the best spa in NYC, PRATIMA's Spa (at the SoHo Building) with the ultimate body and facial treatments, NIRVANA!! To summarize, the SoHo Grand is Manhattan's hidden secret. We are going back!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent location, outstanding attention,”
Reviews.Author: Caroladibar
Reviews.Content: Been many times to NYC, and definetly this one was the best hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, no noise problems, needs freshening up”
Reviews.Author: HaCoMo
Reviews.Content: The best thing the Soho Grand does is the coffee machine on every floor -- free coffee, hot chocolate, or hot water for tea. The staff is nice, the rooms are fine -- very few rooms in NYC are really worth what anyone tries to charge; such is life -- and there are tons of restaurants and sandwich shops nearby for travelers who are on a budget. My big note was the bathrooms. I love the amount of storage space for toiletries -- wall and corner shelving, plus ample space on top of the bog -- but the wallpaper was peeling in several places in my room. That might be because there is no vent fan, which seems inexplicable to me. And the shower head looked and acted about fifty years old. Otherwise, no bedbugs and no noise issues (two things I read in other reviews before staying there). The staff was also regular and reliable with delivering packages left for us at the desk. More accessible outlets would be nice, but hardly anyone has those, so no biggie.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury? I think not......”
Reviews.Author: TW999
Reviews.Content: Having had this 'luxury' hotel recommended to me, I was very disappointed. The worst stay in NYC in over 20 years of visiting. The hotel public areas appeared dingy and tired. The room was small, overheated (noisy aircon only way to sleep) and not very comfortable as it lacked any easy chair, just a basic office chair by the single dirty table with no power outlet adjacent which made work difficult. Calls to reception on several occasions were not answered. The low popint was taking breakfast at the appointed start time of 6am. Nobody was there until 0620, and not laid up until 0630. Orange juice from a gallon industrial container and a mediocre cooked breakfast with poor pastries. Bed was comfortable at least. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!--Needs New Management”
Reviews.Author: JohnM1982
Reviews.Content: I never write reviews of hotels because I rarely have experiences that are so heinous, until my last stay at the SoHo Grand. From calling reservations and having "Elga" on the phone be completely incompetent to check-in taking an unnerving amount of time (the front desk agent Danny made it somewhat bearable) to my room being insanely small (if you can visualize a "Panic Room"). I spoke with the standing mgr and she had this heir of anger with me I felt like I DID something wrong, overall it was an awful example of what "Luxury" should be. **I neglected to mention that after this whole fiasco I was overcharged by over $300 on my bill

Reviews.Title: “Not So(Ho) Grand - in desperate need of good management!”
Reviews.Author: Gudleiv Posted by an Apollo traveler
Reviews.Content: Over the years, I have stayed at this hotel several times. My enthusiasm has dropped every time Ibhave stayed there. I usually stay at The Carlyle when I can, but sometimes the SoHo area is a better location for work trips. My favorite hotel in SoHo is Mercer, but it could be very pricy. I do like the location of SoHo Grand and I used to love the lobby and the bar that served a seafood platter as well as other platters in the old days (I am not sure when they stopped serving these but they are not there now). The people in the lobby are friendly, but I feel that they have little understanding of how to run a hotel. This time, it was the state of the room that bothered me the most. The first room I got had the dirtiest bathroom I have ever seen! It was just unbelievable! Also, there was a used Durex rubber package under the bed as well as a faulty aircondition unit that made loud sounds. There were issues with the bed also, but the issue with the dirty room turned out to be a nightmare. Trying to correct it went poorly as the person from housekeeping barely touched the really dirty parts of the bathroom (they managed to remover old hairs from the drainage system. Management got my attention the second time around, which led to a visit by a confused "acting" manager. She started to tell me that they had no other rooms in my category left and that she could not upgrade me to the next (I was not fishing for an upgrade). She then got my full attention as I gradually got more angry over her total lack of understanding for my rather basic problem! As I had to leave for meetings I did not have time to find another hotel and I had also a friend booked through me at the same hotel on my advice thus giving me more logistical issues (as we both had to find one new hotel). So I gave the hotel another chance. They did not, even on the third attempt, manage to clean the bathroom nor did they give me a new room. This went on until I left the hotel as planned after two nights. I got nothing from the hotel, not even a simple apology! I would not eat the food at a place like this where they can't clean what you see properly - Imagine what goes on in the kitchen. No wonder they have stopped serving shell-fish... In general, I would like to add that these design hotels should learn from the professionals how to run their so called luxury hotels like a normal well run luxury hotel. Then a hotel like SoHo Grand could truly be an excellent property because the design is great and thee lobby and location is unique!

Reviews.Title: “My home when home...”
Reviews.Author: JessKapadia
Reviews.Content: I currently live in London, but was a resident of NYC for ten years.... I have to say that as a New Yorker staying at the Soho Grand is always a treat.... The service is impeccable, the rooms are just lovely and you're close to everything. I'll move back to New York eventually, but I consider the Soho Grand my new home for when I'm home...

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: JL4350
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Soho Grand numerous times over the past 7 years. We have always had a great experience and the staff has always been extremely helpful. We were there with friends last week and the staff went out of their way to make the trip special for all of us. We were also at the Soho Grand in August during the hurricane and the hotel did a great job of keeping everyone informed and comfortable. This is our go to hotel in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: N100
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Soho Grand during a recent trip to New York and I highly recommend! The rooms have a real New York loft feel, with vintage style furnishings and the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in! The hotel itself is cozy and comfortable, yet stylish. The bar is a great place to hang out, although my only gripe would be that the bar staff are pretty rude, which is strange for New York, but we got over it. The rest of the staff in the hotel couldn't be nicer or more helpful, especially the fantastic concierge (I think her name is Alicia?) who recommended some great bars and restaurants that we would never have discovered on our own.Location-wise, the Soho Grand is second to none. I will definitely be going back here!

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious boutique with a great location & excellent bar”
Reviews.Author: dannyrogue
Reviews.Content: My stay at the SoHo Grand got off to kind of a rough start, firstly when I couldn't find the hotel, and secondly when I arrived in my room to find that the air conditioner had leaked water all over the carpet, but with one quick call to the front desk, the hotel staff fixed the whole situation and my stay ended up being a great one. In addition to giving me a couple vouchers to the hotel bar (which I highly recommend because they make the strongest Manhattan I've ever tasted), the hotel staff switched my room immediately, upgrading me to a view of the Empire State Building . . . nice. While the rooms are a bit small and the bathroom fixtures are a bit dated, the overall vibe, ambiance and decor of the hotel are really classy and young. Additionally, the location downtown is perfect for people who want to be able to reach SoHo, Chinatown and Greenwich Village on foot. I'm sure you can find a cheaper hotel somewhere uptown, but for the money, quality and location, I recommend the SoHo Grand for couples looking for a chic, romantic city getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Like home with great staff”
Reviews.Author: momsbroke
Reviews.Content: My second time staying there. My friend and I bring her dog and no other hotel is as dog friendly. Had a little problem with the dog barking while we were at dinner downstairs and the staff and security were understanding and helpful. The doormen seem to really enjoy their jobs. You can't go wrong with the location--cross Canal and you're in Tribeca and the Soho area is great for shopping. We'll be going again as soon as we have the money!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Dechez
Reviews.Content: Very nice rooms and the staff were very helpful and friendly. Close to subways and great places to eat within walking distance. Had breakfast at the hotel one morning and it was nice and relaxing sitting at the coffee table on a nice couch. A bit pricey but, I guess that is to be expected at a hotel for breakfast. So, we walked just around the corner to a nice little French Bakery that served breakfast sandwiches and delicious coffee. Closer to Broadway we found Cupcakes by Melissa which we had to bring some home to Toronto! All within walking distance of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in New York”
Reviews.Author: BobStamford
Reviews.Content: The Soho Grand is a great hotel in an excellent part of New York. The decor is quirky but fun, the staff very helpful. The rooms are a little small for the US, but the location is fanatastic, this end of Broadway is outstanding. Slightly on the expensive side but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Go for the Penthouse!”
Reviews.Author: FoodbloggerT
Reviews.Content: We took a quick trip to NYC and then decided to stay a few nights. Originally checked into a 'regular room' and it was just small and bland so checked to see if the Penthouse loft was available and went for it. Invited some friends to join for dinner on our private rooftop patio. Ordered caviar and Mac n cheese, drinks and had an awesome time! Loved walking around Soho as well. Had such a blast, plan to do it again!

Reviews.Title: “great staff”
Reviews.Author: colleen1982
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our honeymoon weekend and had such a nice stay. We live in Brooklyn and couldn't afford a "traditional" wedding/honeymoon, so decided to have a little stay-cation in Manhattan. We stayed in a simple room, but it was still lovely. Everything is clean and comfortable! which is the key to a hotel room. If you're NOT a snob then this place will suit your needs. It's within walking distance to anything in lower Manhattan/SOHO, and even has great dining and bar in the hotel (although, at hotel prices-so regardless of how good their "Old Fashion" is, it sill costs $21!) Also the staff was awesome. The guys working the door were always polite and conversational, and above all helpful. As well as the front desk reception. Super polite and welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Faded Glory”
Reviews.Author: BatterseaBoy
Reviews.Content: Like most 'boutique' hotels, the service is poor. The staff are always amateurs who would prefer to be doing another job - and all far 'too cool for school'. This place still thinks that it's the real deal. It isn't. Not only that, but is needs a makeover as a matter or urgency. Everything about it is tired. They should invest in double glazing because it has to be one of the noisiest hotels in NYC. By the way, it is unacceptable to have to wait 25 minutes to check-in.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good but not amazing”
Reviews.Author: sweetpea_me
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights as part of a work trip last June. My room on the 2nd floor was a decent size and clean but I was a little surprised at the decor of the rooms which feels slightly old in contrast to the common areas which feel more modern, hipper and buzzier. The room was also quite dark, even during the day. The bathroom was a good size with fantastic products and breakfast at the hotel was also good. The location of the hotel is fantastic, with many cool restaurants, cafes, bars etc within easy reach. The bar at the hotel seemed to have quite a party atmosphere even during the week (I stayed Tues, Wed and Thurs nights) which didn't bother me but might not be everyone's cup of a tea. Overall my stay was fine. The reason I've only scored the Soho Grand 3 stars though is because of the incongruence between the feel and style of the common areas and the bedrooms which slightly put me off. The hotel is pretty expensive I believe (although this wasn't an issue for me as it was a work trip. If I had been paying for the room myself however, I'd have felt it wasn't good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Grand is the the theme and elegant”
Reviews.Author: masscarol
Reviews.Content: Terrific staff, very friendly,energetic and accommodating with great good manners. The food in the restaurant is fresh and healthy and again you can ask for substitutions. And they know how to make cocktails. The many choices for areas to eat e.g. plush leather couches is also a benefit. One lounge room has a gas fireplace; very cozy. Apples in the elevator area and newspapers and wonderful coffee in the morning....heaven. The workout room is adequate. but the rooms themselves are cozy and comfortable and tastefully decorated. Another charming asset is that dogs are welcome and all the dogs I met were well behaved. If I have any complaints it would be that at dinner the lights are too low to see your food and that is a shame because it is so good. I am not a fan of the music played it could be a bit lower in volume. I stay in a lot of hotels and this is my favorite hotel in NY.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay”
Reviews.Author: Mandyfinds
Reviews.Content: After staying at the Soho Grand in Dec 2009, I thought I would return on my latest trip in Dec 2011. Staying in a King room, the Soho Grand was as great as I remembered it. The location is great, close to great food, shopping. Also a 2 min walk to the subway on Canal. The staff are attentive when required and the service was fabulous. Great wifi connection was also available and was free (not sure if this was just part of my package or standard). The room was cozy and bed was seriously comfortable. The room service was also great and i loved their red velvet cupcake! I've noted that other reviews have mentioned that the hotel is "too cool for their own guests" but I didn't think so. I thought they were the right mix of attentiveness and I always received great service from all staff. It's definitely one of my preferred places to stay in NYC and I look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for NYC and nice vibe”
Reviews.Author: WatfordPete
Reviews.Content: For NYC, this was a good price for a 4 night business stay. Good wireless, very well stocked bar - even if it is pricey. Unique spot in the bedroom mini-bar - a personal travel erotic kit! Dim evening lighting makes the place feel very cool as the odd art scattered around the place makes even the most adept art critic amongst us go "I don't get it". Room was very comfortable and the clock / ipod docker was a nice touch. Bathroom was done out well, if the bath was smallish and shower OK. The toiletries were cool, robe comfortable and generally I had no reason to fault the place.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish looks, misleading offers, mixed emotions...”
Reviews.Author: bayimc
Reviews.Content: I have tried making a reservation at their website, (which directs me to some other site...) for two days at the end of December 2011, however I believe there was a technical difficulty on their end. I have tried four different browsers (Safari, Firefox, Internet Explorer, and Google Chrome) on two different laptops; yet all of them lead me to the identical problem. I click on the 'Special Offers' in the home page, I select my dates, then on the second phase of the process, 'Rooms & Rates', the screen is cut in the middle, and I can't see after a certain part... Thus, I can neither see the associated total price, nor have access to any buttons to continue with the transaction. Subsequently, I have tried making a reservation through telephone; the gentleman at the other hand of the phone, Mason, was kind. However, he said I would not be able to make a reservation at the time as the reservations office is closed... Then through emails, another gentleman named George helped me. He was kind and professional too, except that he was not aware of the 'Weekender Double Upgrade' package's existence initially, until I lead him to the according website. I found their online advertisements of 'Weekender Double Upgrade Package' under 'Special Offers' deceiving and misleading. Once I click 'Book Now' and enter the dates, it lead me to a number of rooms with associated prices; which hints to the idea that it is valid on those dates (I do not know if the next steps prompt the visitor of the unavailability of such a promotion as the rest of the steps don't work at all on the reservations website). If there are no such promotions, then simply they should not put it under your 'Special Offers'. Once I made my complaint George handled the situation well and granted the associated 'Special Offer' by giving a complimentary double upgrade to the room. The room was OK-sized, considering it was in the middle of Soho, New York... I LIKED: - the view of Tribeca, the lighting, - the stylish design, - the complimentary coffee on the floor. I DID NOT LIKE: - finding an opened 'Body Lotion' on the floor in the bathroom, - having stain on the main window (the last guest had obviously liked the view so much s/he put his forehead stick his forehead in the middle of the window, and the housekeeper did not realize it; honest mistake...) - having been charged a fortune for a sub-par breakfast, which was supposed to be complimentary (extended my complaint to George, and he fixed the mistake for us; though we did not even eat the second day's complimentary breakfast there, it was that unimpressive) I have been to Soho Grand Hotel on numerous occasions before and thought of the service and the atmosphere as charming, however never had the chance to stay until this one. It was OK; the lobby and the decor was impressive, and the service was friendly at all times; but for such a pricey stay, I would have expected more attention to detail and a more impressive overall stay to be frank...

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Copleton
Reviews.Content: Great location for those wishing to partake in the 'Big Apple experience' all the major retail districts are just a short cab ride away and of course, Soho, Nolita etc are right on the door step and only a short stroll away. Rooms are clean, the beds 'amazing' and the staff are incredibly helpful and attentive, use concierge to get you in all the best places. Bar area is stylish. Soho Grand has a small but well equipped gym.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Vageek
Reviews.Content: Spent Christmas here; Soho Grand has a unique 'NewYorkish' aura around it, room size included. The staff is very professional and friendly, keeping you company even when you go outside for a smoke (thanks, Jose!). I would recommend it to anyone who can value location & feel, versus name and brag rights. A very good launch-pad to Big Apple.

Reviews.Title: “A Unique Spot in Soho”
Reviews.Author: Hannah B
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed this hotel. Loved the lobby/bar decor, found the room to be comfortable. Great location, great service. Loved such a classy pet friendly vibe. I see people complaining about room size, but that is what they should expect in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to spend a weekend away!”
Reviews.Author: Sclark2
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located so close to everything! You can shop around soho, go down to canal & spring street. Tons of great restaurants & places to party. Great area for shopping. The hotel itself is beautiful and elegantly understated. The hotel has a wonderful bar, that always has a crowd. Great food at there restaurant & a killer margarita! Rooms are lovely with great views of the city!

Reviews.Title: “The Soho Grande was kind of bland”
Reviews.Author: David D
Reviews.Content: The lobby and check in area of the hotel is nice, there was a little bit of a typical new york early evening scene when I checked in. The receptionist was very nice. The room was very small, it had a king bed, a small desk, stool/chair and set of drawers with a plasma TV on top. The closet/minibar had been constructed in the actual room, it was almost like an IKEA closet that went up 6.5ft in an 8 ft celing room. It was a very compact room relative to others in the same price range around the city. The bathroom looked like they through some paint over whatever was beneath it....the tub/shower was fine but a little small too. The thing that stuck out, and I'm not sure why, but the electrical socket looked like it was 20yrs old. It just didn't look right in a hotel with a modern design theme....it just showed that they boughtt the building, which was probably a best western, slapped on some paint, hired some IKEA installers and raised the price of the room by 250%. For the cost of the room, the Tribeca Grand, just five blocks south, would have been better. If in midtown, there are several five star hotels in the same price range with much better accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “Needs updating”
Reviews.Author: nozza007
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed with room - cramped needs painting hardly any room to move - my daughters room on a totally different floor (not helpful) was even smaller with limited closet space. The bathrooms were a joke - shower (if you can call it that ) over the bath was not good enough to wash my hair under. had to get maintenance for room temperature and TV! Asked for a cup of tea one morning told it would take 30 minutes. Was never told about ice or coffee machine someone mentioned here and certainly never saw any. Had to vacate room lunchtime although not flying until the evening and they just took room charges etc from credit card before I had even seen the bill even though my luggage was stored with concierge. Couldn't always get a seat at breakfast as they only have seating for about 14 people, the alternative is to sit on sofa's in the lounge/bar area - not ideal for eating a knife and fork meal. All in all never again. Staff were very accommodating though.

Reviews.Title: “Soho Grand - beautiful hotel and great neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: fnqtraveller00
Reviews.Content: Loved staying at the Soho Grand in New York. The staff were friendly and the hotel was beautiful. The location was also fantastic and I really recommend staying downtown as I was away from the shopping madness of midtown/uptown. The surrounding streets have lots of fantastic restaurants and boutiques and a great shopping area of Broadway is just around the corner. Loved the Malin & Goetz products in the bathroom too. I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great neighbourhood but do check your bill”
Reviews.Author: Rafaellito
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in the Soho Grand for a couple of days last week. Area is great, hotel has a lot of style, food is absolutely fantastic. But rooms are really small and not really luxurious. We had a room on a 15th floor with a lovely night view of downtown Manhattan, but it really needed a restoration. One nice touch is that you can ask for a goldish in a bowl, which really improves the mood of the room. However, the issue that really discredited the hotel was double charging and how it was handled. The hotel made a small mistake in the total bill amount and they were supposed to refund us some 20 dollars. But instead of just crediting our card for this amount, they charged us again for the smaller amount and forgot to reverse the first charge. Not a big deal, mistakes happen. But when we saw the credit card statement and try to clear the issue with hotel we got stuck in the limbo. We called the hotel 6 times and not a single time received a word of appology. The person responsible for financials was all the time either unavailable or busy. And to our suggestion that maybe she could call us back, we were told that their policy forbided international calls! Ultimately we will receive our money back, but it's really annoying when someone overcharges you for almost 2,000 dollars and leave you with feeling that's your problem.

Reviews.Title: “Go for a drink, but stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: andrewdaviesxx
Reviews.Content: Lots of atmosphere in this place. Wonderful public rooms, high ceilings, moody lighting; the bar reminded me a little of the Shelbourne in Dublin or some wonderful grand old place in Paris or Venice. Staff are charming, and seem to anticipate just when you want another drink. As a hotel though...well, you go in on the ground floor, with your luggage, and the reception is on the first floor. So you have to climb up the stairs or go a maddeningly short distance in the lift. There were four of us checking into four separate rooms but it seemed to take ages. NIce friendly staff, though. The bed seemed to take up most of the space in the room. Very comfortable bed. The aircon was very loud, woke me up several times in the night; eventually I switched it off. Checking out took as long as checking in. I wouldn't stay here again but I'd certainly drop in for a drink.

Reviews.Title: “i miss the soho grand welcome”
Reviews.Author: mrsmarr
Reviews.Content: i've stayed twice at the soho grand and loved every minute ,the door staff are a joy to'come home' to,and the mangement should be very proud of them. my only advice is to check out a couple of rooms as they are all very unique,and hopefully you'll also fall in love with the soho grand

Reviews.Title: “Great service, average accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Charlie H
Reviews.Content: Everyone at the hotel was completely and perfectly charming however my room on the 4th floor was small with very tired decor - brown patterned carpet, cracked bathroom tiles, terrible shower head, light by bed not working, though quickly fixed when reported. Also the carpet never seemed to have been vacuumed that thoroughly. Breakfast in the club room was delicious. Tried to order room service breakfast on my last day with less success - called up the night before to order muesli and breakfast tea with milk, simple you'd have thought. They called me in the morning to say they were out of muesli and would I care to order something else. They only have about 6 things on the menu so how can they run out of one? I ordered fruit salad. They delivered fruit salad and green tea.. I called up to ask them to change the tea for breakfast tea.. They brought this but still no milk. 3 trips to get fruit and tea! In short, great location, friendly, helpful service but needs a refurb and attention to detail, especially given the prices.

Reviews.Title: “SoHo Style, SoHo Price”
Reviews.Author: FourDayTraveler
Reviews.Content: You know you're in SoHo when you pull up to a hotel that's discreetly marked and you are greeted by a handsome young man dressed in business casual, all black attire...across the street from a bodega. The SoHo Grand is decorated with the urban chic-meets converted industrial loft style that New Yorkers have been overpaying for since the 80's. The room looked great but had a few notable drawbacks: the bed was hard, the water pressure in the shower also. I also noticed the sink dripping and found the TV far more complicated than a TV in a hotel room should be. To the hotel's credit, I did not report these problems--the visit was short and in true NY style there just wasn't time. Pleasant surprises: each floor has a common area with ice machine, magazines and a FilterFresh coffee maker. Smart alternative to in-room coffee. And the doormen are friendly and helpful in a way one would expect from a luxury hotel. And if you want to shop SoHo, you will not find a better location.

Reviews.Title: “Hip and comfy, a rare combo”
Reviews.Author: marrickvillain
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Soho Grand for a week and loved it. The atmosphere was exactly what you'd want from Soho with a stunning lounge/bar, great food and good drinks. Upstairs the room was biggish for NY, comfy and well appointed for a stay that long. My one niggle was that the lobby was such ad estimation it could've hard to get a seat as a guest but I hope to be back.

Reviews.Title: “C.H.I.C. - Cool, Hip, International, Contemporary”
Reviews.Author: alwaystime4travel
Reviews.Content: Very cool hotel with an International crowd. We loved having breakfast in the small dining area off the bar. The food was delicious - fresh, excellently prepared and appropriately priced. We had so much fun chatting with diners from Holland, Paris, and the U.K. . The crowd is well dressed, well spoken and sophisticated. The room was somewhat small, but tastefully done and the bed was delightfully comfortable. The location was great. We love the cool shops in Soho, the fabulous foods of Little Italy and Chinatown that are all just a few minutes away. There were a number of people staying there that were working on the upcoming Batman movie - stunt people, special effects, etc. which made for interesting conversation too. This hotel is not for everyone, but if you like cool, hip, international and contemporary settings and clientele then this is the right spot for you.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Soho Grand”
Reviews.Author: loubenny
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Soho Grand In April for 5 nights and loved every moment of it. This was our 7th visit to New York and hotel was everything we wished for. Loved the fact the hotel was very modern and great location. I have stayed in many 5* stars hotels and cannot understand why people on here don't rate the hotel. If you want to stay somewhere different and different area The Soho Grand is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Funky, fun spot”
Reviews.Author: oyyveyy
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this property several times now and have always loved it. Location is great - there are several subway stops within a few blocks. Easy walking through SoHo, Chinatown, Little Italy.... The Grand Bar (in the lobby) is a trendy fun place to hang out. You can even request a fish to be brought to your room during your stay to keep you company! (we named ours Norman). Rooms are clean and a decent size for NYC standards (which can be quite tiny). Staff is always helpful and friendly. We would absolutely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, buzzy hotel...”
Reviews.Author: scot_in_oz
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 12 nights, and on the whole had a pretty positive experience, with a few glitches. It's an iconic hotel: its interior is designed to pay homage to the cast iron that characterised Soho's lofts and warehouses over the last century, so the lobby staircase is an amazing creation of metal and lights. Some reviewers have said it looks dated, but I hope the hotel keeps it - the interior is about acknowledging the history of the area as well as looking cool. The lobby can also be a bit intimidating: some of the door staff are a bit too cool for school, as are the bar staff (the bar is next to the front desk check-in area - which means it can be loud and dimly lit if you arriving at night, as I did). Rooms can be small, as people have noted, but that applies to many NYC trendy/cool/ boutique hotels. If you want to be sure of getting a decent-sized room, book one in a category such as Deluxe King or Executive King. The rooms are beautifully decorated: luxurious bedding, fantastically comfortable bed and pillows, great leather chair, good curtains and black-out blinds; cute wallpaper in bathrooms, excellent tub, great toiletries (Main & Goetz). Good support services: free local phonecalls, free printing (good if you are there on business, as I was). Staff: the cleaning staff are great, friendly, thorough etc. Front desk: variable: some are pretty unsmiling; others are extremely helpful. When there was a problem with the heating/cooling unit in my room (it started to pump out warm air, despite being set to cooling), they said 'an engineer' would look at it. Twice 'an engineer' apparently came, but all that was done was to set the thermostat lower, which totally failed to have any effect. When I complained that nothing had changed, they moved me to a different room, with an upgrade to compensate for the inconvenience. Room service: avoid, unless you have an unlimited expense account/trust fund. Ludicrously expensive. Nice touch: they will provide a goldfish if you ask. If you're staying on your own, as I was, it's nice to come home to! (You should ask about food for the fish - I discovered that I had to feed the fish, after a few days - the poor thing must have been starving; no-one had provided food for me, but house-keeping did after I asked about it.) Overall - I enjoyed my stay, and would certainly stay there again, if only for the beds, which were wonderful. (And no bedbugs.)

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay”
Reviews.Author: rileyspike
Reviews.Content: We arrived in New York on the Queen Mary 2, so after a week of shear luxury my expectations were very high. When we pulled up outside the hotel we were greeted by friendly staff who took our bags, the check in was also easy and once again the staff were very friendly. We had a king room which was small but well furnished and comfortable and what I have grown to expect from Manhattan hotels. The view from the window was wonderful and completed the room. It may sound a little silly but if you wish you can have a pet goldfish in your room to look after during your stay. Being a pet lover and missing my dogs terribly I couldn't resist asking for one, I decided to call the little fish Bert and he really made the stay that little bit more special. The hotel provides free coffee from coffee machine's located on each floor, I wouldn't bother drinking it as I found it awful! The mini bar was also very expensive! The bar was busy and had a nice atmosphere and the food was very good. The location is fantastic with lots of restaurants and shops located near by. Overall I really liked the hotel and would stay again ... my partner however described it as being "pretentious" but I couldn't disagree more. In my opinion it beats the boring chain hotels that litter Manhattan hands down!

Reviews.Title: “pretty and small”
Reviews.Author: alesims
Reviews.Content: If you want to be in the soho area, this is a great option. The rooms are very nice and small. I don't reccomend eating there because it's not fantastic food and the prices are high, but it's soho! there are many options for food! The hotel often has good deals so try to get one ;) over all it's a good and cool place.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: ItinerantLondoner
Reviews.Content: Positives Great location (Soho) Clean, slick room and bathroom, good facilities and nice bed Helpful staff (concierge for bookings and desk) Good general atmosphere (lots of buzz, plenty of visitors to the bar who weren't from the hotel) Negatives Room sizes are small (as described elsewhere) Internal decor and style feels a bit dated (i.e. edgy 10 years ago) Very pricey for the room size and general experience (but then, this is NY) The whole thing was a bit too self-knowing cool - behaviour of some of the staff jarred Summary Hotel is in a great location but the price is high for little space (though what there is is quite nice). It's an interesting place to stay with a vibrant atmosphere. The decor is very slightly worn in the obvious places, and looks a little outdated (standard redbrick building on the outside and Soho loft on the inside). Some of the staff were trying a bit too hard to be cool at the expense of allowing a slightly more laid back atmosphere, especially in the bar. Would stay here again given the location, but would probably look elsewhere first. I feel for this price there may be better options.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money for the location!”
Reviews.Author: bububub
Reviews.Content: I am a returning guest at this hotel - mainly for the great value for money for the location. The hotel is obviously not as new as some of the other hotels in Soho, but the great service, great location on West Broadway just next to 2 subway stations and the price are a big plus. We were even upgraded to a corner room on a high floor this stay! Obviously the rooms are not as new and trendy as some of the other hotels, but the bed is comfortable and the room is bigger than rooms in other Soho locations. Overall, I highly recommend the Soho Grand for anyone wishing to stay down town at reasonable price!

Reviews.Title: “Living Soho's Spirit”
Reviews.Author: Paultheowl
Reviews.Content: We arrived to this hotel as we want to be inside the Soho area. The room was quite small but it's not unusual to have in Manhattan small rooms for high prices. Anyway, the architecture was amazing, attractive decoration according to the spirit of the area. Its lobby is something to get known. The location was optimal, beside all the art and fashion stores. Also the subway gates are nearby. It had bycicles to ride along. I think that the high rate is according much more on its location than the whole service. It's a very advisable hotel if you want to know deeply the Soho and live Manhattan from another perspective.

Reviews.Title: “What a disappointment - Not such a grand experience”
Reviews.Author: FatherTed1930
Reviews.Content: This hotel is by no means the typical "New York experience" and by that I mean if you want to be treated like you don't exist or that they don't in the slightest appreciate your business -- this is the place for you. I felt staff were very aloof and I have never experienced that in any hotels I've stayed in around the world. I know its not a traditional style hotel, but I stayed in a boutique hotel in San Fran last year and the experience was like night and day. The hotel itself reminded me of walking into The Tower of Terror at Universal Studios in Florida. The room and public areas are so depressing you just don't enjoy spending time in them at all. Overall cleanliness of the rooms also could do with a step up. If I had had time to request a move of hotel I would, but we were there for only five days so not worth it. At checkout the staff also tried to charge us for the room even though it was already paid for. One to avoid for the future.

Reviews.Title: “A Soho Grand experience”
Reviews.Author: Arlene T
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my accommodations and the delightful Soho neighborhood. Would love to return if the opportunity should arise. About the room – Honestly, all I did in the room was to change clothes, take a shower and go to sleep. Spent waking hours with my delightful friend and colleague who had traveled in from overseas.

Reviews.Title: “Not convinced”
Reviews.Author: BrunoBibou
Reviews.Content: Excellent situation just south of Canal St at a walking distance of all great Soho shopping. But for the price, the rooms (and especially the bathroom) are quite small. I experienced some problems with TV. The staff at the reception is very helpful and nice, the other staff (restaurant and bar) is more of Abercombie & Fitch than real experienced waiters and waitress. Drinks and breakfast are awfully expensive. As you can imagine, not my prefered hotel in the big Apple. I'll avoid it at my next travel.

Reviews.Title: “Soho Grand at NYC”
Reviews.Author: travelthroughmyeyes
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a very good location and in a great walking neigbourhood close to Tribeca , Greenwich village, Little Italy and China Town also lots of great restraunts and shopping just steps away. But i is time for a rehab as soon as i entered the hotel it was dark and gloomy and i get the industrial look but this one needs a face lift! The front desk was very nice at check in and everyone in the hotel was pleaseant the room was a little weird and had a very strange looking ceiling that look very unfinished? I probably would not stay there again but for the price or better said NY prices it was a good deal!

Reviews.Title: “Plush”
Reviews.Author: GreenBarrel
Reviews.Content: The Soho Grand had the most comfortable bed I've ever slept in. The staff was top of the line and extremely friendly. Best of all they put a goldfish in my room so I wouldn't miss my fish at home.

Reviews.Title: “Has its moments but...”
Reviews.Author: narisettir
Reviews.Content: Plus...location, staff, front-desk, good coffee on each floor, nice open views if you are on front side of the hotel. Quiet. Minus...tiny rooms (even by NY standards and for what they charge), totally not suitable for business traveler (despite free wifi) because there is but one open electric socket, not desk, a small table that is very uncomfortable to use because of low chair, no newspaper on floor or for room (a few on the front desk). So for the money they charge, not really worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not fabulous”
Reviews.Author: CampbellScot
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel. It's very VERY soho. The vibe is downtown chic. The decor is very industrial. When my sister and I arrived we were greeted warmly and offered glasses of champagne. Not a bad way to start a vacation! The room was nice, but quite small. We were on the fourth floor and overlooking a lot of other buildings! It was a Soho view. It was pouring down rain when we arrived so we decided to watch some dvds we brought with us until the rain let up.The television was top of the line and when my sister and I couldn't figure out how to work the dvd player, someone knocked on our door and set it up for us. Apparently if you are messing around with the television, the IT guys downstairs are alerted automatically b/c we hadn't called for anyone! Over all, we had a pleasant stay. I don't think it was anything all that spectacular, but the rooms are clean, the beds are comfy and the location is great. If you can get a good rate and want a central to Soho location give it a go. I wouldn't pay the overly inflated rates for this place though. The regular rooms aren't worth the price. The celebrities that gush about this place are staying in the celebrity rooms...nothing like the rest of the hotel. keep that in mind!

Reviews.Title: “Nice NYC hideaway”
Reviews.Author: Triptatoo
Reviews.Content: We accidentally booked the Soho Grand and it was a good find. The hotel is located away from the business hustle of the city, but right next to kitchy Canal street and trendy Soho. The building interior has that unique NYC pre- war feeling. The guest rooms are average with nothing exceptional, and the corridors try for chic but look more cheap. One major disappointment was the shower. When paying so much for a hotel room, I don't appreciate the water saving misting shower. We loved the lobby lounge - an excellent place for out of the way business meetings. The restaurant was the biggest surprise. Small, cosy, excellent food. I didnt feel the same hospitality nor glam factor of the other nearby Soho boutique restaurants, but will definitely go back for the dining and may try the rooms again if the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not Grand”
Reviews.Author: jasoncrh
Reviews.Content: I stayed here over labor day weekend and got a good rate. I was in town for a wedding and most of the events were nearby, so it was convenient. Overall this is a fine choice. The decor is definitely dated- from the '90s and there was obvious wear in places. The rooms, as others have noted, was small. There were some stains on the carpet and I was definitely nervous about bed bugs, but didn't see any evidence of them. That said, the bed was very comfortable and the shower had great Water pressure. I also liked that there was free wifi. As far as I'm concerned, all hotels should have this. Public areas of the hotel were nice but again it just feels very '90s. I had a drink at the bar- nice and strong. All staff I met were great. Friendly and accommodating. One weird thing- one enters the hotel on the ground floor and has to go one floor up for reception. There's no sign indicating this and when I arrived there was nobody to direct me. I stood there for 5 minutes before a fellow guest advised me of this. Overall, this is a solid choice. Good not grand, great service, and I think it's due for a facelift.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but no effort”
Reviews.Author: Cazfrank
Reviews.Content: Am staying there at the moment,all in all not bad, Asked for a high floor room given 4th floor looking at the side of a building. A BIG birthday treat for my 50th turns out to be just a trip, as I said nothing special. Maybe it will improve!

Reviews.Title: “Still itching”
Reviews.Author: JetSetJeny
Reviews.Content: Great location, close to everything. Beautiful hotel. But they have bedbugs, just saying.

Reviews.Title: “Great location right in the middle of all the soho activity”
Reviews.Author: monkeybones
Reviews.Content: Very friendly, intimate boutique hotel. A bit pricey, but they extended a good group rate for a family wedding. N.Y. Eclectic design, but comfy and a very good restaurant. Lobby was a great place to gather for a cocktail & apps.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special.”
Reviews.Author: Frankie M
Reviews.Content: Its just an average hotel , rooms have absolutely nothing special , service is slow , ( we left our breakfast outside of the room and no one picked up until they brought our breakfast the next day ). Threy also have this old air condition machines inside the room that make a lot of noise !!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not as Grand as Expected”
Reviews.Author: FLmom100
Reviews.Content: My sister and I had a weekend at the Soho Grand in December. We were looking forward to experiencing a very cool, hip downtown hotel. I guess the owners think keeping everything really dark makes it hip and cool. I just found it annoying not to be able to see. The room was very small and did not seem luxurious at all. I've heard its sister hotel, The Tribeca Grand is much nicer. It wasn't a bad hotel, just had much higher expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Rude, Dated, Corporate and Bed Bugs”
Reviews.Author: brunello48
Reviews.Content: This place has lost its charm and is truly rough around the edges. I have stayed there before and frequented the bar which sadly also pretty tired. The place is as hip as "Alice in Chains" or "Sound Garden"---the 90's. I admittedly had a dispute with the hotel over an accidental over booking---we booked one room and it turned out we had reserved two-----and the hotel would not cancel the second reservation. My wife and I werre made to pay for two rooms even though it was a clear mistake. We booked that morning on-line and the confirmation went to her spam so we booked another room thinking there was no reservation. Total corporate BS. The front desk guy was nice an knew we were being screwed....the financial guy they put on teh phone was a real corporate creep. I have stayed at this hotel four or five times since it opened and have spent alot in the bar and they were rude and inflexible in light of a clear mistake. It was not really the money---it is the principal. The room is standard and seeminly comfortable with a nice view. After a nice meal at Aurora around the corner...to bed. And in the morning..... adding insult to injury.....low and behold bed bug bites. Three in a row on my back. Yuck. STAY AWAY.

Reviews.Title: “loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: kathie l
Reviews.Content: The room was bigger than i expected having come from the tiny rooms of midtown manhattan (Mansfield hotel). There was ample cupboard and draw space. loved the bathroom with bath! and rubber ducky!. The room type was a superior king. My daughter and I stayed here for 1 week. loved the breakfast and bar area. Staff are courteous and friendly (some can be a bit snobby, but you just ignore those)...generally though the staff were helpful. The location is great. chinatown one way, and soho the other.. lots of great unique boutiques close by and lots of great restaurants too. Our accommodation included the breakfast which was great, otherwise the breakfast is quite pricey.. better to go outside to have breakfast if you are staying there. however, the location where breakfast is served in the hotel is great. room service is expensive, so we brought take away to the room a couple of times. it is pet friendly and the complimentrary bikes are great if you are into bike riding.. I would definitely come back to this hotel.. absolutely loved everything about it. The bed, is one of the best beds i have slept in.. and i travel a lot for work, booked this hotel through Magellan Vacations, who were wonderful and got me a great deal. Try them next time you plan a holiday in the US.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay at Soho Grand”
Reviews.Author: SHJ31
Reviews.Content: I was in NY for a week and the company I work for had booked Ace Hotel for me for the week. I found Ace Hotel very noisy and decided to check out early and booked Soho Grand instead. A very wise decision! I had read the reviews before booking, but decided to go with my own instinct and they turned out to be right. The positives (a short note: I am almost 7 months pregnant and not the easiset guest to service due to ths!): - Really good rate on the internet - we had booked a King; when my husband checked us in, he mentioned that due to his wife being pregnant she was a bit sensitive to noise, so could we please have a quiet room - they reception immediately offered an upgrade to a room on the 15th floor with no noise. What an incredibly nice gesture - fabulous room - absolutely wonderful views, light and airy and very classic and soothing colours and furniture - I loved it. And the bathrooms are very nice as well - beautiful lobby - very Grand! and in general a chic hotel - perfect for urban, creative people, and families alike (I noticed this in particuar given that I am due to have a child myself - and would definately stay here with a child) - wonderful courtyard to enjoy a drink weather permitting - perfect location for a weekend amidst shops and restaurants in Soho - great service - from reception to bellman, to housekeeeping - I did not in any way recognise the reviews. The staff is helpful and sophisticated in any way - without expecting a tip for everything they do - Free internet, all the TV channels in the world, Movies on demand and whatever you can expect of a hotel this standard any negatives: Not really; The only thing I can think of is the minibar prices that seem a bit steep, but normal for NY hotels - and we decided to book a car to the airport through our regular limo service rather than the hotel as the hotel quote for a car was 3 times the price we pay with Carmel Limo in NY (but my guess is that the car service the hotel offers is far more comfortable/luxurious than our regular service - though I would recommend Carmel Limo anytime when needing a car in NY). In regards to minibar: there is a deli across the hotel where you can stock up if you feel prices are a bit too steep for your budget - and I am in general not prone to spend my money on a minibar diet coke at 5 dollars - regardless of where I am. We did not eat at the hotel - but regretted not doing so as the eating areas were georgeous and the room service menu alone looks great At night the hotel bar (both inside and outside) is somewhat lively but not to an extent where it is annoying for guests not wanting to join in - you can easily access your room without being confronted by partygoers at the entrance - and you cant hear any noise from the bars. All in all, an incredible joyful and pleasant stay at Soho Grand - and we are definately coming back. I have stayed at so many hotels in NY and this is one that stands out for the positive experience - quiet, comfortable, good service, beautiful decor, great location and nice vibe.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Location But Some Drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: G3A
Reviews.Content: Soho is in our opinion is the best place to stay when in New York. But which hotel to stay, is another issue. Location is great. There are very nice cafes and restaurants around. So when you are back from your daily sightseeing or shopping, after refreshing in your room you can just walk and choose one of them. Grand hotel is very clean, very pet friendly but has average rooms and some unpleasent suprises. For example the business center is actually a room with 5 computers and 1 printer. The printer has the functions of fax and scan which you are not allowed to use. And neither the machine nor you know this. So you can try all day until you give up and ask reception. The lobby of the hotel is in deed a bar&restaurant. So although you are a customer of the hotel, you are not allowed to sit there unless you order something to eat or drink. This is the part actually decreased the value of the hotel in my point of view. I didnt really enjoyed to be kicked out of my hotels lobby because I do not want to drink anything at the moment. America is known for huge sizes, but unlike its name Grand Soho Hotel rooms are ordinary. Maybe this isb normal for New York. I do not have any other New York hotel exprience to compare. The hotel is rustic. Some really enjoy this. I personally do not like it. I prefer more coosy,comforatable and modern design. But it is totally a personal taste, so I'm just telling you to know. The design of the hotel is indeed mostly beautiful and charming. But personally I would enjoy to have a dinner or pass through this kind of a place, not sleeping in it. The A/C is a lot noisy. The only way to sleep is to turn it off. And the shower is definetly not user-friendly. No adjustments can be made.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, ideally located and good service”
Reviews.Author: philippeenrique
Reviews.Content: I was skeptical when I arrived at the Soho Grand, because of the average rating in trip advisor, some of the comments on the site and the fact that we already visited it some years ago and were not particularly impressed at the time. I must admit I have been pleasantly surprised. The location is ideal, right in the middle of Soho, perfect. The staff is helpful. Yes, they are gorgeous and sometimes have an attitude, so what? That's part of the charm of it. But what is new is that they are also helpful. The room is relatively small but decent, the bed is gorgeous, the room is clean and the bathroom is nice and they were nice with late check out. Now, one thing that is really bad is the breakfast. Don't even try it for one day. Totally overpriced, no buffet, and portion are for fashion people. "Swiss porridge or muesli" was a joke (some dry oat with thick yoghourt, who on earth can eat that without choking). Anyway, apart from breakfast, a good place to remember and I acknowledge the efforts they have made to make the staff less arrogant and more helpful. I would come back here.

Reviews.Title: “Dark & Gloomy”
Reviews.Author: RaleighGirl13
Reviews.Content: I just returned from NYC where I took my niece for her graduation present. This was my 7th trip to NYC and I always stay in a different neighborhood to explore. You walk into the SOHO Grand and are greeted by almost complete darkness. Very gloomy. Not cheerful & happy like our personalities. The reservationist said they would probably put something in our room as it was for my niece's graduation - nothing. The room was nice, but when checking my bank account I found they were holding $150 per night for "incidentals". I quickly got in tough with a manager and complained, had to call my bank, and had to have the Grand fax a letter to my bank telling them they could release the funds. Now, do they do that to celebrities, obviously wealthy individuals? I may not be wealthy, but I was carrying a REAL Louis Vuitton shoulder bag. The outdoor area looks nothing like the online photos. The second night out remote was not working and an "engineer" promptly brought us another one. When we turned the tv off at 3am, it would not turn off the cable box - so we slept with a bright white light on. When I called in the am, they questioned my knowledge of turning off a tv, but did bring us another remote that truly worked this time. I'll NEVER stay there again. The only nice, non-snooty people there were the concierge - exceptionally nice.

Reviews.Title: “What's the hype?”
Reviews.Author: Vestfoldgirl
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel 2 hours before regular check-in time, which i 3 pm. Room not ready, so left the luggage in storage, and went for a walk in the neighbourhood. Hotel called when room was ready. We were told our luggage would be brought to the room, but after waiting one hour for the luggage, I had to get in touch with reception to see what was going on... Seemed to be a problem locating it, but shortly after it arrived... Had a problem with the telephone and TV, and both time the service person was there within seconds, and very friendly. (Both times it was my lack of technical skills that lead to the problems with the phone and TV, so hotel is not to blaim for the problems..) Stayed at 11th floor. Room on the small side, with really, really boring furniture. A table and only one chair. Bed was nice enough, we slept well. Bathroom OK, plenty of shelves to leave your stuff, and nice soap, shampoo etc. Nice towels. Bath tub not tempting. Free wireless in the room. Turn-down service. The "gourmet" minibar is just a regular minibar... The in-room safe was large enough to also take the computer. The hotel is so dark, dimmed lights in the lobby, elevator etc, but it certainly has a personality. Had breakfast at the hotel just one morning. Expensive and nothing special, although my daugther loved the ricotta pancakes. Service professional, but no outstanding friendliness, I would say. Lot's of restaurants in the area that serves better breakfast at a greater value. For instance; Le Pain Quotidien. And what's the deal with the "doormen"? You have to go through two double door to get in, and the doors are quite heavy, at least when you carry lot's of shopping bags. Sometimes they opened one of the doors, but not the next, some times neither of the doors. Very patchy. On check -out we left our luggage in storage for a couple of hours before heading to the airport. The person handling this is really bored and uninspired, no smile. When we picked it up he did't even bother helping us down to the entrance (we did tip!), so again we had to struggle the luggage through the double doors ourselves. When getting a taxi to the airport the "door" man (who, again, did not help us with the doors) suggested we take a hotel taxi, as this would be only USD 65, while the yellow cab would charge USD 72 and upwards. This sounded like good deal, but as the tourists we were, we wanted the New York experience of taking the yellow cab, so we opted for that. And guess what, the yellow cab was also USD 65... The location of the hotel is very good both for shopping in Soho, Greenwich village and you can walk to the ferries if you want to see the Statue of liberty and Ellis Island. Chinatown is a short walk away. I will not stay in this hotel another time, as I am sure there are other hotels that are better for the same value. However I would love to come back to the neighbourhood!!

Reviews.Title: “I dont intend to go back”
Reviews.Author: Leflaneur14
Reviews.Content: The reception staff were always nice and helpfull but the bartenders were so impolite toward customers that I went there once and for all. The rooms need a refresh and the whole Hotel is a bit decadent.

Reviews.Title: “Very good, but past its prime”
Reviews.Author: Animal70
Reviews.Content: Let's start with the Great SoHo location of course. Decor has a slightly tired "industrial" theme that was probably cool 15 years ago. Rooms are small, but far from the smallest I've seen in NYC. Some of the furniture in the room is not well suited to the space, most notably the breakfast table and chair. Overall hotel was very clean, although far from new. Food was good. Beds comfortable. Noisy air conditioning. Mediocre water flow in the shower. Fitness centre was a bit small for my liking. Overall, a mixed bag. So, this would have been a rather average experience. However, I was completely blown away by the truly outstanding service. Everyone was courteous and helpful, from the guy opening the door at street level, to the front desk, to the room service attendants...everyone! Room service was probably the fastest I've ever experienced, never taking more than 20 minutes. I had one issue to raise with the front desk and it was promptly taken care of. For a NYC hotel that attracts such a mixed clientele and seeks to maintain something of an edgy image, I was surprised. Very well done.

Reviews.Title: “Best NY experience”
Reviews.Author: LiuAvakian
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at the Soho Grand and it will definitely not be our last. Finally we have found our home in our most favorite city in the world. This place is as "cool" as Kool can be, and yet somehow there is a place here for any kind of traveler to feel at ease. There is nothing formal about the SGH and yet there is an air of sophistication and elegance that fits all. Our room was well appointed, the views awesome and any items additional items we needed were provided immediately. Service everywhere was efficient and courteous, and the Concierge Desk was the best ever. The SGH is most definitely a New York kind of place.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Soho”
Reviews.Author: sukxsx
Reviews.Content: I booked through Booking.com. It was pleasant supprise on price.In any case, Hotel was very clean and roomy compare to other hotel Staff was very friendly and really like the rounge Bar. In addition, everything was very close walking distant on Soho. Great location and great hotel. I wish that Hotel promote more affordable price regular basis. I will definitley stay at Soho Grand Hotel whenever I visit NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at the SoHo Grand!”
Reviews.Author: Chris_23_11
Reviews.Content: Was there at the end of June for two nights. The room was not as large as I would have liked, but the amazing views, and service, made up for the size. I was on the 10th floor and had a corner room with SW/SE views of the World Trade Center and the Hudson. Room was very clean; enjoyed the bath products and complimentary internet. Had continental breakfast one of the mornings and the pastries/coffee were very good. Overall, the staff was very nice, but the hostess was incredibly charming and friendly. Fantastic location for shopping and dining in SoHo. Five to ten minute walk to Chinatown and Little Italy, and about a ten to 15 minute walk to the World Trade Center and downtown. Various subway stops within a few blocks.

Reviews.Title: “good location not great hotel”
Reviews.Author: richardpeace
Reviews.Content: Although in the fashionable Soho district with plenty going on around.I found the hotel cold in many respects the decor of the hotel,service.The rooms are small by New york standards and are very bare and minimum which is a theme across the hotel.I only eat breakfast which was Ok at best and the only time the staff seemed engaged was when asked for the bill. There was no common meeting area which is an issue if you want to be here on business and the gym...a convereted bedroom with 4 items of equipment. My view you can do much better.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: MyBoyBlu
Reviews.Content: Decent location with short walk to subway and several options for food nearby. Hotel as a whole is underwhelming. Rooms small and bland - although I had ok view from high floor. Lobby bar small but busy and quite relaxing at the same tome. Didn't try the restaurant. Ok choice if you want functional but don't plan on spending much time in the hotel itself.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: pippy204
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, Fantastic room for NY and great Location in the heart of Soho. The beds is one of the best I have ever slept in. The breakfast was great and set me up for the day, complementary drinks were offered on arrival as well.coffee machines (free) on each floor was perfect when I woke up with jet lag at 4am and couldnt go back t sleep. We did opt for the black fish in our room which was a nice friendly touch. Not stuffy at all and will be back!

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: spcohio
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Soho Grand this week and I have to say it is one of the best places I have stayed in NYC! It is a nice location with a tone of restaurants and things to do in the evening. Even though I was there on business it was nice to be down there at the end of the day, much more laid back. The rooms weren't huge (it is NYC) but everything was top notch, Frette robes, really nice bed and bedding, free wifi. Even the bath amenities were really nice. Super clean too. The staff couldn't have been nice, called when our room was ready and even knew our names the next morning at check out. Didn't have food or drink, but the cocktail area looked great!

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, tired decor”
Reviews.Author: travelkat123
Reviews.Content: Good points: Amazing location, great vibe, but that's where it ends. The rooms are tiny, really tiny, even by NY standards. The dark and dull interiors are now showing their age and the place needs a refurb. Staff beautiful but more interested in "looking cool" than being of service to you, the paying guest. Stay at the Ganservoort or the Mercer.

Reviews.Title: “very cool, unpretentious.”
Reviews.Author: tomspottiswood
Reviews.Content: really enjoyed my visit here. great views of downtown, cool energy in the lobby and bars, garden bar was a party on sunday afternoon, favorite hotel in ny now. in the middle of great shopping and restaurants. Concierge was real helpful too.

Reviews.Title: “What are they putting in the water here?”
Reviews.Author: Matt2540
Reviews.Content: One of the most unique properties I've ever stayed at, you have to think of a stay at the SGH as more like going to your cool (rich) uncle's place than going to a hotel. I say that because each of the staff treated me more like a member of the family than as a guest at a hotel. The front door/bell stand guys were not only welcoming and professional, they were always eager to help. When I arrived at the hotel at 8PM on a Sunday night and approached the desk, the gentlemen was very nice and when I said "checking in", he addressed me by name. [Now stop and think about that one for a second - he was not only expecting me, he had taken the time to know me first - so here I stand in the middle of Manhattan and this guy knows my name. INC-RED-U-LOUS!) Yes, the room was a bit small, but it was clean and beautifully appointed in rich, subtle furnishings. The bed was comfortable - but forget all of that. Let's come back to that remarkable staff. During my brief stay I encountered no less than 10 hotel staff, all who treated me like they were really happy I was there. Example: I step out the front door one afternoon and they are doing a photo shoot of the hotel. The general manager takes me by hand, a block away, and hails a cab for me. When I return to the room later that day, some gifts and a lovely note were in my room. I was embarrassed by the level of service I received and I'm not a cornfield hick by any stretch. I have found my new home in NYC and I am happy to be able to post such a positive review of this establishment. Yes, I saw the negative remarks about the staff before I went and was a bit nervous - BUT - there is a truth to life, you reap what you sow. I hope those reviews mean that the staff have this attitude: "if you're going to be nasty to us, we're simply going to reflect that back to you."
