Only dislikes: -> The curtains are not "blackout" so your room lights up at dawn; -> I could hear the water in the bathroom next door. Both of these things are also true when I visit my uncle's house.

Reviews.Title: “Average, and overated for the price - go for the James instead”
Reviews.Author: Tylor_the_Lorax
Reviews.Content: I have been to NY 4 times this year, and stayed in 6 different hotels (2 in single trip because moved from Business trip hotel to personal trip hotel), and I have spent well over 30 nights in hotels in 8 countries this year. I normally do not right reviews, however, on this occasion I thought it necessary. I found the hotel was expensive for what was delivered. The concierge was not responsive. We spent 4 days at the hotel, and the bikes where never available. The hotel is becoming dated, and a bit worn. The turn down service came at 6pm, and if you where getting ready to head out, they did not come back, nor did the turn down service refresh the room( something you would expect at this level of hotel). We left feedback after the stay and not receive a response. If I was looking for a hotel in this area, I would suggest the James ( which I stayed at over Easter), located right around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “oasis in soho”
Reviews.Author: FoiledSeattle
Reviews.Content: Stayed here mid-week in June, booked by corporate office - what a treat. For Manhattan, I thought the King room was spacious, with a great view northwest of the SoHo area (6th floor). Room was quiet and well appointed (great mini-bar and room service). Staff was appropriately chic/boho for the neigbhorhood and price - but refreshingly friendly too. Both bars are worth a stop (indoors on 2nd floor and outdoor in the summer). I'd stay here again for any trip that I needed to be near lower Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay.”
Reviews.Author: Annione
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week, in october. The room was charming and spaceious for NY standard. Very polite starff, comfortable bed, nice bathroom with a tub (good after a looong day walking around in NY). We had everything we needed! Cleanliness was good, fresh towels every day, if needed.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in NYC”
Reviews.Author: wrightbg
Reviews.Content: My new wife and I stayed in the Grand at the end of our honeymoon and, having visited New York many times before and stayed in hostels etc, it was a real luxury for us to stay at a place we've walked past so many times before and had heard so much about. The service was excellent and we were immediately moved to a room with an incredible uptown view of Manhattan - it really was incredible to be looking out over the Empire State Building and the GE Building. The room itself was beautifully designed, the bed was comfy and the bathroom was like an interiro designers dream! I can understand some people who have expressed concern here about the noise from the bar downstairs as it was very loud, but we were far enough up not to be bothered by it. We had a fantastic stay as a real one-off luxury - its a beautiful hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: TravelToday4Fun
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tribeca Grand and were disappointed. The air conditioning didn't work and we were forced to change rooms in the middle of the night. Instead of having the night removed from the overall invoice, we were given a one night credit for a future stay. Not really appropriate given the circumstances. After booking another stay at sister hotel the Soho Grand we were told the one night credit could not be applied despite the fact that we received 'welcome back' emails from the concierge of the Soho Grand. On the day of our first night stay at the Soho Grand, we had to switch plans as our child became ill and we weren't able to travel. After discussing the issue with an individual of Guest Services, he said we could pay for the first night and then we would have 6 months to use it against a future stay. After charging our credit card, he sent an email stating that we only have 3 months to use the credit. After we called back to confirm our conversation, there was no apology for the misinformation provided or acknowledgement that he had made an error. However, we did get a snooty response of you are being offered a courtesy. My experience is that this is not a hotel with class despite the $300 price tag. There are so many other options in the city. Two strikes......

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the top dollars... extremely small rooms”
Reviews.Author: max15031983
Reviews.Content: I did not like the hotel at all specially since i paid so much for such a small room. the appereance and lobby of the hotel is really nice. thats where it stops. the rooms are very very very small. i did not like the way the rooms looked. very dark and dull. it was not cleaned properly. the floor was dirty and sticky. My a/c was not working. it took them a long time to get it fixed. the bathroom is also small and was not up to the mark. will definitely not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Time for a design refresh.”
Reviews.Author: pricelinetraveler
Reviews.Content: I always book my New York hotel stays using Priceline, so invariably, I stay in one of the big Midtown hotels. For this trip, I decided to try something different and stay downtown. The Soho Grand is ideally located to take advantage of all that Downtown Manhattan has to offer. The Soho neighborhood is one of the most interesting parts of the city, with great shopping and restaurants and within easy walking distance to Lower Manhattan, Tribeca, and Greenwich Village. The vibe is definitely younger and more casual than Midtown, catering more to residents than to tourists. Find a favorite coffee shop, a neighborhood bodega, and a favorite park, and it's easy to imagine yourself actually living in the city for a few days. The Soho Grand's location is its biggest asset. As a hotel experience, it's good but not great. The decor is "Soho chic" circa late '90s / early 2000s... very dark, heavy fabrics, "distressed" finishes. Tastes have changed, however, and what once was cutting edge now seems unnecessarily gloomy. The hotel is 15 years old; it's time for a refresh. The room was small, but that is to be expected in New York. The bed and bedding were comfortable, and all of the basics were in place. Internet access is free, which was a pleasant surprise. Service was uneven but overall good. Check-in was efficient and friendly. I wasn't impressed by the concierge services, however. The concierges didn't covey much enthusiasm, and their suggestions for dining and entertainment weren't inspired. One thing to be aware of... if you're coming to New York to do a lot of "touristy" things (e.g. museums, sightseeing, etc.), you're probably best staying in Midtown. Otherwise, you're going to be spending considerable time on the subway or taking expensive taxi rides. The Soho Grand is really a better choice for the "seasoned" New York visitor who just wants to relax and enjoy the city.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location...loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: globetrotting87
Reviews.Content: Located in the heart of Soho, surrounded by all the shops and many good restaurants! We really enjoyed our stay.. the staff were always very kind and helpful. The food in the restaurant was very good (especially the lamb and the salad!) and we loved the lobby bar!!!

Reviews.Title: “Soho Grand opened a whole new view of New York for me.”
Reviews.Author: evian8899
Reviews.Content: When in New York with friends or visiting my daughter, I have always stayed uptown because I didnt know any better. I love to shop in Soho but couldn't find a place I felt comfortable and secure to stay. My daughter kept raving about the Soho Grand and she was soooo right. My sister and I are in our 50's and we loved it. I never encountered a rude or abrupt employee, was greeted as if I was the most important guest that weekend. The room service was faster than imagined and the location was ideal for shopping and eating out. I will never stay uptown again and will plan to stay at the SOHO GRAND everytime. They are very customer orientated.

Reviews.Title: “possibly the friendliest hotel in New York”
Reviews.Author: PaulDScott
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Soho Grand and both my wife and I were very impressed with the hotel. The staff were friendly, courteous and ever so helpful. The rooms although no larger than most hotels in New York were very tastefully decorated, very clean, had ample facilities and an extremely comfortable bed. The concierge service was excellent, even when my wife called when we were out, they were still able to book us a table for dinner. Our only minor issue is that the rooms facing West Broadway did suffer from the noise of the hustle and bustle of the Soho area at night. This wasn't a problem for us, but a consideration for those less used to a city.

Reviews.Title: “Good room, very good food, and variable service”
Reviews.Author: triptraveller
Reviews.Content: At Soho Grand, the room was small --even by New York standards- but it was very well equipped: good lighting, wardrobe/armoire for clothing, a safe, and a comfortable bed with good (cotton - not "blended" with polyester !) linens. Likewise, the bathroom was small, but very well equipped, with both built-in shelves, and a floor unit with shelves for storage. Plus, a facility for brewing coffee, tea, and chocolate was available in the hallway, outside of the room. The food here is very good -- excellent club sandwich comes with fries and salad, for example. Service at front desk was good at check-in, and good for the initial room-service order. However, the wait for breakfast from room service was 50 minutes, and required two follow-up prompts by phone. If the size of room is not an issue, and if the Soho location is desirable for a stay, Soho Grand may fit the bill. But as othertripadvisors have indicated, service can be variable.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, but expensive ...”
Reviews.Author: jipe0404
Reviews.Content: For such a price, it can be good !!! No particular problem with this hotel : spacious rooms, confortable beds, helpfull staff, close to subway (A, C, E lines, 7 minutes to Time Square), well situated in Soho (shops, Brodway, ...) 1h30 from JFK Airport by subway (no change), but I guess we are the only customers of this hotel that took trains to travel .... others prefer taxi ....

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel Nothing over the top”
Reviews.Author: mogul4x
Reviews.Content: Decent hotel. Nothing over the top. Brought tea and cupcakes from nearby Billy's Bakery (Recommend). Was eating tea and cupcakes in an open area which looked like a lounge. The resturant manager approached and said "no outside food, this is a resturant". He didn't say weather there was an open area to chill and drink/eat my food so I just left. Normally stay in upper NYC hotels. They seem better, areas to sit, less crowded streets and of course Central Park. With that said, I would recommend uptown hotels compared to this one.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: richardc345
Reviews.Content: Very polite and accommodating staff. Hotel rooms were a good size, the bar and lounge good. Nice "quieter" location. The council decided to resurface the road outside our room during our stay and we were moved to a different room without issue. The icing on the cake was that the new room was on the 15th floor (1508) and had stunning views of the Manhattan skyline. A fantastic break.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!”
Reviews.Author: monaelsa
Reviews.Content: I have just stayed in another New York hotel and I was so disappointed that I felt compelled to write a review of this great hotel! I spent 7 nights at the Soho Grand in November 2010 with my partner who was on a business trip. I was just there to visit the city but I spent a fair amount of time in the hotel. And what a treat! The check-in was done by a friendly and attentive receptionist. Our room was available straight away. The check-in desk is on the first floor but there are lifts and these were working great and fast during the whole week. I asked for a goldfish to be sent to my room (it's something special they do for people who miss their pets back home). The next morning, I found a big bowl with a cute goldfish (it is fed and cleaned by the staff). The room was a little bit on the small size but considering it is New York City it is reasonable (I have been in smaller rooms). It is elegantly decorated: sleek & modern with a retro feel to it (check the towel rack & sink in the bathroom, very Art Deco). There was a small walk-in closet (with mirrors, it reminded me of the Orient Express) and a sort of tall boy so there was plenty of room to put all our clothes and hide our suitcases in the "closet". The bed was not big but it was comfortable. I always find beds too small as I have a king size bed at home, it is hard to go smaller! There was an ipod alarm clock (it charged my ipod nano), a flat tv screen, a dvd player, a phone and an iron/ironing board. The bathroom was small as well but there was a decent bath/shower and space to put your toiletries. The lovely touches were numerous so among those I enjoyed: the most: the goldfish, free wi-fi, free apples, magazines & coffee machines on every floor, the decor (trendy with a retro feel) and my favourite: a decent list of dvds to borrow and watch in your room (complimentary). The staff is extremely efficient (in all categories) without being obstrusive, which means that they were always polite, very helpful and friendly but they keep it professional. It is a trendy hotel but it still manages to exude some class. Spotless rooms, lifts, corridors, clean & tidy housekeeping. There was only one con: the occasional noise coming from the internal court (mainly when they receive deliveries from big trucks). I recently went on another trip to New York and could see the Soho Grand from that hotel and were so envious of the guests of the Soho Grand!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, fantastic staff, avoid the breakfast”
Reviews.Author: fasteddo
Reviews.Content: I would happily recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a comfortable, stylish SoHo base. We had a very nice corner room which was plenty big enough (palatial by usual NYC standards), clean and quiet. The doormen, bellboys and concierge team looked after us incredibly well. Always a smile on their faces and genuinely willing to help. Our only small disappointment was breakfast. It appeared that there were not enough staff so service was rushed and more often than not inaccurate. There are plenty of great breakfast venues nearby so I would suggest eating outside the hotel. Otherwise, a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel with Great Service and Style”
Reviews.Author: SFAdventurer
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel and I'm generally very picky. The Soho Grand is in a great location, with a warm inviting lobby and staff. The room are on the small side but very well appointed and comfortable. The aesthetic is elegant comfort. Make sure to get a higher floor and then you can avoid some of the comments made about noise. My room was on the 7th floor and very quiet. I slept very well in the wonderful bed. The hotel has a nice gym if you want to work out and a salon if you want a little pampering. There's no spa but the salon has many spa services. The Lobby Bar is a great spot for a quiet breakfast in the morning and then turns into a hip scene at night. The staff looks straight from the catwalk. Both the men and women are gorgeous without a hint of snobbery. You can't beat this hotel for location.. when you walk out the door, you're in the heart of Soho and all of its shops and cafes.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but not quiet”
Reviews.Author: Biggesthead
Reviews.Content: Chic hotel with friendly staff. Trendy looking lobby. Excellent location for boutique shopping and plenty of small restaurants around. Subway stop is 5 minutes walk away. Free wifi is always a good sign (and should really be the standard nowadays). However, it lounge/club (located next to the lobby) can get pretty noisy over the weekend. We staid at the 7th floor and yet I was woken up by the rowdy clubbing crowd on the street with noises of glass shattering and constant car-honking. This may very well be an one-off incident however. Side note: tricky toilet. Either I am stupid or need operating instruction. :-) I recommend this hotel for a nice couple getaway or singles looking for a good time to spend over the weekend. Definitely a nice refreshing change from those hotels at the tiring tourist area, e.g. Time Sq.

Reviews.Title: “Fun”
Reviews.Author: Dootsien
Reviews.Content: Having grown up staying at the Regency and St Regis i must say i love the cool vibe and layed back atmosphere of hotels like the Soho Grand. We had a great night which started out with drinks in the bar and wound up with a party in the penthouse with one of the best city views. This is now our romantic choice for a night in the city!

Reviews.Title: “Stylish but comfortable boutique-style hotel in fab location with great staff.”
Reviews.Author: Boring_Pass
Reviews.Content: Okay, so it's not amazing value for money and the rooms aren't huge, but this is New York so we'll take those negatives as a given. On the plus side, this is a perfectly-situated hotel on the edge of TriBeCa and Soho. Perfect for shopping and restaurants, and the C line is close by so you can head uptown no problem. Inside the hotel, the decor is a deft blend of stylish and comfortable. I actually prefer it to its sister hotel TriBeCa Grand, where they spent all their time designing a cool atrium and forgot to put any love into the rooms and bathrooms and corridors. The bars are really great, a good mix of sofas, tables and barstools, with unusually friendly hosts and excellent and knowledgeable bar staff, moody lighting and everything from sharp cocktails to a well chosen mix of draft beers. A very cool place which is now my first choice when in NY.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Birte_11
Reviews.Content: The rooms are clean, very stylish (everything is kept in dark colours, so sometimes you wish just to switch on more light) and the view is nice. The beds are comfortable, unfortunately the noise from the street was a bit annoying in the morning but all in all the location is great. All shops are nearby. I had breakfast in the nearby "Pain Quotidien" which is 2 minutes walk away from the hotel. The staff was friendly and the food in the restaurant was delicious. Will definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, funky design”
Reviews.Author: investroll
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel with a rather funky theme that seems like an old converted warehouse, even though all the rooms seem quite modern: Clean and comfortable. Everthing works nicely. The one weird thing is the widespread use of incandescent lights. I understand that as a theme item in the hallways (even though it leads to dim and gloomy light), but in the rooms it just seems like a huge energy waster.

Reviews.Title: “don't believe the hype”
Reviews.Author: sirtravel
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel, a very good hotel, but not a great hotel. The room was comfortable but there were a few items that worked poorly or were confusing. The toiletries were very nice, but some had been previously used and when I finished them they were not replaced on the second day. I would stay here again only if I had business in SoHo/Tribeca.

Reviews.Title: “Reconnecting with old friends”
Reviews.Author: PeterfromNE
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the SoHo Grand for over 10 years. Unfortunately, due to a job change, my frequency deminished over the last 3-4 years. However, a of late my stays will be increasing to 2 -3 times per month. Upon arriving recently, it was great to see all the familiar faces and be greated with great warmth and sincerity from all the staff. From Jose & Martin on the front door to Kelly in Guest Services. There are a lot of hotel choices in NYC, however the SoHo will always be my first.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, beautiful, great hospitality, rooms beautiful, fantastic”
Reviews.Author: aaron1617
Reviews.Content: we had the best weekend, the soho house was amazing our room was beautiful right when we walked into the hotel i felt like i was in europe and when i walked in my room wow the view was beautiful looking out over the city with the lights off amazing, The bedroom was so beautiful and the bathroom was wow didnt want to leave my room, The Hotel staff couldnt of been nicer from the being when checking in, to taking us to our room they couldnt of done enough for us. The bar area was beautiful and so nice as were the beautiful people hanging out. We cant wait to come back to stay at the soho house we loved it.

Reviews.Title: “by far and away the most enjoyable, peaceful and comfortable stay i've had in NY.”
Reviews.Author: jdo16
Reviews.Content: second to none in NY, the soho grand is a home away from home. its always a pleasure to come back and sad to leave. great staff, beds are amazing, views are incredible and its a cool place to hangout.

Reviews.Title: “the PHENOM Soho Grand”
Reviews.Author: WLSIII
Reviews.Content: I have been neglect in visiting this site to lay praise at the feet of the Soho Grand, the consistently great stays and experiences I have had there over the course of the last 12 months. From the outstanding curbside services and greetings (these people remember you and your visits like you were just there the day before...), to the smooth check-ins (my room has never not been ready upon check-in), to the quiet, tranquil rooms, to the very attentive service in the bar and restaurant - on top of a great scene, great people, great vibe (stayed in plenty of NYC hotels, this one of the best for ambiance...). OK, some of the pricing can get a little whacked depending on what is happening in NYC during your stay, but this happens no matter where you may stay in the city. Some of the greatest NYC restaurants in the surrounding four square blocks of the hotel (Cipriani Downtown two blocks away - tell them Wim sent you...), shopping too very good. All thumbs up, way to go Soho Grand -

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, location and vibe!”
Reviews.Author: iitsthatguy
Reviews.Content: Rooms are spacious and clean. Bar area is a great scene. And something you don't often get in ny...the staff is friendly, courteous and really makes it a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but................................................................................”
Reviews.Author: vegas123
Reviews.Content: We have just returned to the UK from a 4 night stay at the Soho Grand. The location is great - this is our second trip to NYC and having stayed near Times Square first time round the Grand certainly beats it for access to great shopping and great bars and restaurants. The rooms are also kept exceptionally clean and we did not expereince bedbugs like the previous reviewer. However, the place is really dark and sombre looking - everything is brown and in the lobby and bar areas you cannot see outside so it feels quite claustrophobic. The rooms are also a little cramped (we had a standard room so I guess if you pay more you could get bigger rooms. We were on a highish floor but we were kept awake by traffic and shouting from outside so we didn't sleep that well. Also the heating in the room was impossible to turn down so having spent a couple of nights dehydrated and feeling like dry old prunes we had to ask for a technician only to be told that it was either that or having the heating turned off altogether - which wasn't as bad or as cold as it sounds. As previous reviewers have mentioned, the staff are very friendly, helpful and attractive and the clientele are also stylish and certainly not short of a bob or too so if, like us, you don't dress head to toe in designer gear and are looking for something a little more relaxed then this might not be the place for you. A few other words of warning - you do have to pay for the bottled water that is in your room and we didn't discover this until check out - and I know I am starting to sound really mean but $10 a bottle does seem a liitle on the steep side - we liked the fact that you vcould help yourself to tea, coffee and hot chocolate which are available on each floor off the corridors - but it's not great quality and it's coffee mate not milk? All in all we did have a great time and I would recommend to friends as the location is super and we have some of the best food in a long time - would recommend Balthazar for a meal and Fanellis, Lucky Strike and the Broome St bar for drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Style and the place to be seen”
Reviews.Author: Cocoda-Cambridge
Reviews.Content: If you want to treat yourself in NYC, try this or its sister hotel. Great location, cool decor and certainly on the agenda of the beautiful people. Pricey, but hey, this is New York and I've certainly paid a great deal more for a great deal less.

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful or rather non existent service”
Reviews.Author: gascony
Reviews.Content: Stayed foe a week - lugged bags in and out several times (even when you ask for help they take the bare minimum ----- I've been to ny dozens of times, I have never had worse doorman service). Receptionists unbelievably vacant "oh ok" is all you get. Rooms are dark and noisy - apart from traffic the heating/air con unit is incredibly noisy - receptions response (despite hearing the noise whilst I was on the phone with them) ....... "oh ok". Lighting in rooms is terrible, and they didn't Hoover at all ....... Same piece of plastic on the floor unmoved for a week. Variable success with hot water, some mornings I had it, some I didn't.

Reviews.Title: “Ringing In The New Year With Perfection”
Reviews.Author: Kirk007007
Reviews.Content: The SOHO GRAND is the pinnacle of excellence. From the opulent halls, delicately lit and attractive wine bar to it's comfortable and classical rooms. Coffee machines on each floor, lotions in abundance and a DVD player in the room (Like in New York, visitors would rent a DVD, but knowing the option is available is comforting.) The staff were all full of smiles, offering assistance and even when not seeking assistance, it was available. When I return to New York, and it is only a matter of When, I would return to the SOHO GRAND in a heartbeat. Yes, I rang in the New Year in a hotel befitting a celebration.

Reviews.Title: “A utopia in Soho”
Reviews.Author: PerCCrest
Reviews.Content: Everything was perfect -- the room was available at 10 am when we checked in and we got a free upgrade to a king-sized bed in the room. At 11am, we got a complimentary glass of champagne in the lobby ... A perfect start to a girl's weekend.

Reviews.Title: “soho chic”
Reviews.Author: lisarhodeisland
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Soho Grand. The staff is sophisticated without being fussy. They picked up on a subtle interaction at check in between my spouse and I and followed up with a complimentary bottle of champagne to honor his birthday. These are the little details that make life that much better. My 9 year old also enjoyed the goldfish they loaned us for the evening.

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay in NY”
Reviews.Author: SAWWashingtonDC
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Soho Grand a couple of time a year since its opening. The experience is always excellent. The one thing that always excels is the service. Staff is great, friendly and very helpful. We are always made to feel welcome and valued. Rooms are well presented and clean and the location unsurpassed. I won't stay anywhere else in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: whatevs187147
Reviews.Content: It's cool, edgy, in SoHo, lovely and good-looking staff... No wonder why after 14 years this is still THE hotel to stay in downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Our home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: Druidess_11
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at the Soho Grand for about a dozen years now, several times a year, as my Maine-based business takes me to New York City on a routine basis, and once or twice a year I've managed to bring my two children along for the ride. My 12-year-old daughter has been staying there since she was a baby, and my son is now 18. It's unique in that for a trendy hotel with plenty of high profile guests, we as a family are made to feel very at home by everyone, from the desk clerks and concierge to the doormen (the Grand has the BEST, most charming doormen in the City!). There are far more expensive rooms at other hotels in the City, and the Grand's rooms are small, but I think very reasonably priced for the value. Learn the subway system and you're not only within walking distance of great ethnic restaurants in Little Italy and Chinatown, not to mention fabulous fashion shopping for all ages, but you can be in downtown Manhattan in a matter of minutes for meetings and all that that neighborhood has to offer. I've entertained well-known clients in the hotel's fabulous bar lounge, and even spent Thanksgiving weekend there with just my daughter, enjoying a festive and wonderful feast in the dining room this past season. The 800# will try to send you to the Tribeca Grand, but I always insist upon the Soho Grand. In actual fact, I hesitate to recommend it, because it might get "discovered" by a wider audience. The only caveat I would mention is it's not for the sloppily dressed. Unfashionably attired families would feel out of place, unless the parents were famous.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic all round :-)”
Reviews.Author: craiglegrice
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a great location - good shopping, bars, restaurants etc nearby. Easy cabs, subways, walking etc. People complain about room size here but it is NYC, all rooms are small. If you don't like it, book a suite. This hotel could benefit from better leisure facilities but that's it really. Other than that it's intimate and cosy but with all the amenities you need really. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and Elegant”
Reviews.Author: Suncat5
Reviews.Content: We were here over Christmas and really enjoyed our stay. The hotel is elegant and trendy, but not snobby; the staff are warm and welcoming. The location is fabulous, we loved staying in Soho, its fun to walk around and look at all the shops even when they are closed; the neighborhood is at a much smaller scale than Midtown, there are a ton of great restaurants nearby. We enjoyed the lobby lounge for a drink and snack; it is relaxed, muted, and food & drinks are good. The concierge was very helpful and gracious in getting us a Christmas dinner reservation (we dined at Shorty's 32, which was excellent!) The hotel is several blocks from the subway which was ok as we like to walk. Our room faced the street and it was relatively quiet at night (for NYC) but it was a holiday. We were in a Superior King, but beware that the bed is smaller than a regular King; she said it’s a "European King". The bed was comfortable, the TV worked fine. We had an issue with the heater, and they sent someone up promptly to fix it. The room was clean and comfortable, but quite small and lighting is dim, it would not be great for work if here on business. If we stayed here again, I would book a Corner King on an upper floor to get more room.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: steve_prescott
Reviews.Content: The only reason to stay here is if you don't know any better--but now you'll have no excuse. Our check-in experience was terrible; 20 minute wait. Tiny room with random, tired furniture. No hot water--warm only. Extreme traffic noise on 15th floor. Exercise room small, unkempt, poorly equipped. Public spaces were small, crowded, unwelcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Worst experience ever!!!!”
Reviews.Author: WJ083
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last New Years Eve. While the location was good and the décor was modern and very cool, the experience was awful. The room was very small. The lighting in both the room and the bathroom was very dark and there wasn’t any counter space. Our room (which cost almost $500 for the night) overlooked the ally where the dumpsters were and the employees went to smoke and chat. We are very experience in the NYC atmosphere so much of this is not a surprise, however, when we returned from the Bluenote, we found the lobby and hallways it to be extremely loud; it was after all New Years Eve so we just ignored it. However what we couldn’t ignore is the fact that the hotel alarm kept going off all night, approximately every 45 minutes jolting us out of our sleep. In the morning when I mentioned it to the desk clerk all she said was “oh, sorry, we were having trouble with the system”. I feel we should have been compensated. This was not acceptable. We couldn’t wait to get out of there. We are going back to the Bluenote this New Years Eve and are NOT going stay here. WJ, Fairfield County, CT

Reviews.Title: “Staying at the SoHo Grand is like coming home. I enjoy everything about it!”
Reviews.Author: SFO13
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the SoHo Grand 2 or 3 times a year for last 6 or 7 years. I usually come alone to visit friends and family, do shopping and just treat myself. The room is always clean, comfortable, simple but elegant and very cozy, just what I expect. Staff is very friendly and helpful and always greets me as I come and go. I never feel lonely or homesick due to the warm, friendly and comfortable atmosphere. When ordering in-room service for breakfast, everything is perfect, coffee is hot, fruit, eggs or anything ordered is very fresh and well prepared. Sitting in the Lounge, having a glass of wine or coffee is fun just to enjoy atmosphere and watch people. I love the neighborhood and now have my favorite restaurants and shops and am happy just staying in the area. I plan my trip around good rates at the SoHo and am always satisfied. I truly love everything about coming to NYC and staying at the SoHo Grand Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “The Price of being "Hip" .....”
Reviews.Author: MonkeyGreen
Reviews.Content: Is a less than stellar hotel experience. The service at this place is lacking. I asked about having a shirt pressed, they sent up an iron! The staff seems better suited to holding people behind a rope at a nightclub than being in the hospitality industry. Tiny (even by NY standards) rooms (especially for the price). Small gym, overpriced and overrated. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, ambience and service -- will come back for the lounge and the comfortable bed!”
Reviews.Author: subellistri
Reviews.Content: Great experience - the staff was friendly and knowledgable, the lounge was trendy and elegant and great for people watching, and my king bed was one of the most comfortable I have slept in. I loved the eclectic architecture of the hotel, and the staff was great in recommending restaurants in the area, as well as giving me a great short-cut to my business meeting.

Reviews.Title: “Still Looking Good”
Reviews.Author: otberbur
Reviews.Content: Perceptions of relatively-high end hotels in Manhattan can be influenced by how much you (or your employer, or your sugar daddy) are paying for the room. At the (fairly high) rack rate, my base-level room at the Soho Grand would have been a slight disappointment. At the US government per diem, however (probably 30 percent less than the rack rate), it was excellent. Several reviews I read before my visit suggested that rooms at the Soho Grand were tired looking. That was not a problem. Both the common areas of the hotel and my room looked first-rate. The furnishings in my 6th floor room were all in excellent shape. The decorating scheme was more muted than I would have anticipated. While not as neutral as what one would find in a national chain, it was far less idiosyncratic than what I've encountered in several other similar properties south of Midtown. And there was nothing weird about the room design. The furnishings, however, seemed a bit too large for the room. While the size of the room was not small compared to other New York properties, it did seemed cramped. Two people might find it claustrophobic and someone paying top dollar would find it inadequate. The room lacked a lounging chair because there was simply no room for one. The bed, however, was extremely comfortable -- among the best I have ever encountered. The bathroom (in contrast to the main room area) was spacious and well-designed. There were a few snafus. I could never log on using the supposedly free Wi-Fi. Fortunately, I was able to get a good AT&T cell signal from my room (which is often a problem in Manhattan). TV controls were overly complicated, and the remote control functioned in a non-intuitive manner. While I made few requests of the staff during a one-night stay, the service I received was polite and efficient. The hotel's location, close to transit, dining, and shopping, is excellent. After a subway ride, I was checked into my room within 30 minutes of stepping out of my train at Penn Station.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: shlak
Reviews.Content: One of our favorite hotels in new york. Great location in Soho. Only a few blocks walking from the heart of Soho. The bar area is lively in the evenings. Only downside is that Rooms are small as they are in most other trendy hotels in the city but still worth the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced faux chic NYC experience”
Reviews.Author: IslandHopper888
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Soho Grand a few times in recent years. For some reason the hotel (but not the wonderful lobby level lounge!) seemed tired looking and more than a little worn out. For the $500 a night I was paying I got a tiny King bed room with concrete ceilings and all the ambience of a Motel 6 with none of the value. Yes I know I was paying for location but I couldn't help but feel that I was also paying (through the nose) for some kind of phony NYC chic experience that the SHG was not delivering this time around The service seemed labored and/or non existent (did they cut back on the front door staff for some reason?). I found it hard to get through to the front desk when I had a question or two. Stood in line for 20 minutes at the check in desk when my keycard stopped working one day, etc etc. Just so this isn't a total complain session I can say that the recently remodeled SHG lounge on the lobby level really is wonderful. Great place to hang out and watch the people that are still in awe of NYC chic. Also it was a pleasant surprise to get free internet for once Staying at the James (next door) next time

Reviews.Title: “Cool, chic, perfectly positioned - couldn't be better”
Reviews.Author: cleo65
Reviews.Content: Just loved this hotel from the stylish lobby and fab bar to the comfy rooms (although a tad small, but it's central NY, what do you expect). Thos hotel is perfectly positioned for exploring the interesting parts of NY downtown or it's a quick cab ride to the glitzy shops and so on around 5th Ave - personally I prefer the more interesting streets of Soho to the big stores. Soho Grand has a superb bar, just perfect for chilling into the early hours. Full of all sorts of people, not just guests. All in all, can't wait to go back. Am tempted to take the kids here next time too - they seem to cater for them very well, special menus, a pet goldfish for their stay and so on.

Reviews.Title: “excellent, is everything you need and manages it with ease”
Reviews.Author: alsyd
Reviews.Content: I had a great stay at Soho Grand after a terrible stay at the GEM hotel in Chelsea. The Grand is brilliant, cool bar, great breakfast, the rooms are spaciousm, stylish and very clean. The concierge/door guys are punctual and friendly, although the concierge desk staff could use some courtesy lessons, a smile wouldn't have hurt. Front deck / check-in staff were brilliant. Wifi worked a treat, food was good, laundry service did a great job. All in all I had a great time and felt at home. Stay there!

Reviews.Title: “From the time we arrived the experience...”
Reviews.Author: Bigkahuna4444
Reviews.Content: From the time we arrived the experience was horrible. We came to new York for a romantic trip and this place absolutely ruined the first day of our trip. No one was outside to help when we got there. No one directed us where to check or what to do with our bags. I paid for a grand corner king room that was so small I can't imagine what a standard room must be like. No one brought our bags to the room till I called down to the bell desk. The room was noisy as was the plumbing (banging all night) The air conditioner stopes working in the middle of the night and instead of moving us they sent a repair man who worked on the old air conditioner next to the bed by my wife. After they fixed the air it worked for an hour. I got up (at 3am) and went downstairs and told them I wish to check out. They would not refund me and I had to argue to keep them from charging a 10% fee for checking out early (we were supposed to stay 4 nights). An employee of the hotel grabbed my arm and kindly recommended the trump soho only a few blocks away. trump soho is 20 times the hotel and was 100 dollars cheaper!!'nm

Reviews.Title: “Just ok”
Reviews.Author: love2travel2525
Reviews.Content: Only positive is the hotels location lounge bar and valet staff Once you enter your pokey ordinary room the hotel falls flat The bathroom is awful Not the cleanest hotel Tiny dreary fitness room Overpriced hotel Make sure you stay in the highest level room and not near a corner room as they look straight into your room and can see you in bed if you have your blinds open The rooms are dark

Reviews.Title: “Clean, contemporary trendy hotel with very nice customer service”
Reviews.Author: gracie284
Reviews.Content: Great customer service, quick and friendly. Room very clean with a great comfortable bed. Awesome lounge and great delicious and plentiful continental breakfast. The wait staff goes out of their way to bring you exactly what you want and need. Only drawback was it was very close to the Holland Tunnel therefore a bit noisy around rush hour. Try to stay high up in the hotel. Rooms a bit on the small side but that is expected in the big city.

Reviews.Title: “Uber cool”
Reviews.Author: munchymolly
Reviews.Content: Fabulously stylish hotel, greatest doorman on this planet, a staircase that should be in a gallery..... The only down side would have to be the extremely aloof bar staff. But I can even forgive them and their prices.....

Reviews.Title: “A very accomodating hotel”
Reviews.Author: thomasbeard
Reviews.Content: Whilst on a project in New York, I stayed at the Soho Grand as a long term guest for 2 months. I chose it because it made a nice change from the generic chain of Hiltons and Marriotts, it is also based in a really fun part of Manhattan and as I was training for a cycling event, needed a hotel that would accomodate my bike too. The Grand came up trumps on all of these areas and the hotel staff (in particular the front door men) were a joy to be around. Although they may be a little understaffed at times, the service is very good, the rooms are clean and very comfortable and if it's too hot or cold to go out, they have a really good bar and restaurant. My girlfriend came to visit for a week and they looked after her well while I was at work during the week and provided us with bikes at the weekend so we could tour the city. When I first arrived it felt a little too trendy but beneath the surface it's very relaxed and made my two months in New York really enjoyable. It's expensive but in line with Manhattan prices

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: TheHolidayQueen
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights in November on a room only basis. The room was small and had an ok view towards the Hudson. Comfortable bed, strange mishmash of furnishings, but ok. Ok bathroom - bright, funky wallpaper and nice toiletries. In summary, small but good value by New York standards. We didn't use the bar and had breakfast out. The gym was small but had enough equipment. Lots of excellent restaurants, bars etc nearby and very well located for downtime shopping and sightseeing generally (a number of subway options nearby). We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Thank goodness for the AC”
Reviews.Author: dublinonsea
Reviews.Content: I really liked this place... i knew New York in June would be hot... but OMG. Thank goodness for an endless supply of ice, AC and a TV for the world cup! A great location to be in - as you are never far from anythign but not smothered in broadway or in a tourist dump. Bar is open late night too - which was a god send. Happy place to be with a chic feel and rooms for NYC which are bigger than the usual match box

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel excellent location”
Reviews.Author: KEB09
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights and our first night was spent in a room on the 3rd floor which meant we could hear the music from the bar area as the 3rd floor is open to the bar and reception .We asked to change to a room on a higher floor the next day and we were moved up to the 15th floor where we had fantastic views and couldn't hear the loud music (would recommend taking ear plugs to drown out the noise of the traffic). The hotel staff were all really helpful and very polite. The rooms are a good size, contemporary and well maintained and have very comfortable beds. My only complaint is that I would have liked a bigger bath towel they were skimpy even for a woman of 5'3"!! The doorman and the concierge gave us some really good recommendations for restaurants. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Ooooliday
Reviews.Content: Coming to Soho Grand is a great experience : location is amazing, rooms are beautiful. Friendly staff makes you feel like a New Yorker. I recommend corner rooms for their breathtaking view, or floors above 7.

Reviews.Title: “Superiour Customer Service. Everything an upscale, Boutique Hotel should be!”
Reviews.Author: merryweather65
Reviews.Content: My Partner and I stayed at the Soho Grand for a wedding weekend. Upon arrival, we were greeted with a refreshing, moist towel, and a glass of wine. Our room was on the 5th floor, in the corner, so in terms of noise level, we didn't have a problem. Everyone from the check-in staff, to the doorman, to the maintenance workers were friendly, and accommodating. I was surprised by the level of friendliness, since the hotel has a reputation for being trendy (I figured people might be "snooty") I called and requested towels in the middle of the night, and they showed up at my door within 2 minutes. The bar and the restaurant are VERY expensive ($5.00 for a cup of coffee), so if you are on any type of budget, I would recommend eating someplace else. This hotel is dog-friendly and it was fun to sit in the lobby and watch the pooches walk in and out. In general if you are looking for a fabulous boutique Soho Experience, I would recommend the Soho Grand.

Reviews.Title: “superbe hotel but.... cold!”
Reviews.Author: swissfox
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, excellent location, but very cold for those who look for a warm mood, specially in soho. Exactly the opposite of a BB. Normal, 4 stars, but just to share. For 100 euros less, we did prefer really the Washington Square Hotel in the village.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: be32
Reviews.Content: Nothing that special with this hotel. Very trendy and noisy. Room on third floor so it got lobby noise, plus faced south where there is a hotel owned outdoor bar with very loud music. Asked how late the music would be played and they said 11:00-11:30. Said they would ask to turn it down but did not. Like others said rooms are small, A/C blows next to bed and bathroom doesn't vent well. Nice that internet is free and they have a decent business center, though printer kept jamming and nice workout room.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: THELUCKYCAT
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed this hotel very much. Front desk clerk accommodated my request for a different room on a higher floor, with a city view. Room was clean & nicely decorated and had everything we needed, with a comfy bed; and very pretty bathroom with a great (high flow!) shower. From what I could tell, housekeeping staff is first rate (clean rooms, clean halls, extra towels, no garbage/carts left around,spoke English) We did not go to the bar/lounge but it looked to be very lively and fun. Tiny negative: three doormen were present upon our arrival. One held open the door, but then, as another reviewer mentioned, we encountered another set of door we opened ourselves; and went straight to the concierge desk only to find that we had to go up another floor. Did not have to wait but doormen or sign should explain; and with three doormen I would think one would go open the second set of doors. Overall a great hotel in a location close to several neighborhoods we wanted to tour and I would most definitely stay here again (Disclosure: got a great rate through Priceline so I was pleased with the room rate.)

Reviews.Title: “Average NYC hotel”
Reviews.Author: BrandonUK07
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights during August 2010. My wife and I booked this property last minute and wanted to stay in the Soho area of NYC. Here are the following points on the hotel: - Pros: Great location to shopping and restaurants in soho. Subway is a few blocks away. Hotel staff are very helpful and offer great service. Housekeeping did great job. Free internet. - Cons: Hotel seems a bit dated. Bed takes up almost all of your room and leaves little room for anything else (suitcase, ironing etc.) No safe in room. Room had a musky smell most likely due to the air conditioner. They do not have central AC which is annoying. Bed was small for 2 people and was average as far as comfort of sleep. Bathroom doesn't vent well and steam from shower takes up entire room. Overall, this was an average NYC hotel, but it has potential to be a great property with some renovations to the rooms. We were only here to sleep and shower, so the room was not a big deal to us. Book this room if you're looking for a 3-4 star hotel in soho but you don't mind small rooms that need updating. We booked for about $185/night + taxes/fees.

Reviews.Title: “More of a boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: PeterBToronto
Reviews.Content: It's in an area that is being gentrified, I guess, although the view from my room was of old, rundown buildings (or the backs of them). Others had views of more renovated buildings. It's in a neighborhood with restaurants and bars. For me, way too far from the action in Times Square. It looks like it was once an old factory and they have kept some parts of the original decor, like floors etc, as part of the atmosphere. Mini bar prices are ridiculous as usual, $5 for a bottle of Coke. The restaurant/bar is fine; had lunch there. Not cheap but typical New York prices. My room was very nice, well furnished, new LCD TV, quiet, tons of pillows of various type, a small walkin closet, renovated bathroom. I stayed there on business and did not choose this hotel; frankly, I prefer to be closer to the theater district.

Reviews.Title: “Slight above average business hotel”
Reviews.Author: vagabond_b
Reviews.Content: I had a business trip and was forced to stay at the Soho Grand due to the last minute booking. The hotel is in a good location for nightlife and trendy restaurants. Upon arrival, I was greeted by the door staff and directed to the lobby for check-in. The hotel bar/lounge is right next to check-in which makes it a little annoying to check in during evening hours because of the decibel level of the music. However, I got checked in and sorted out just fine. The room was a bit smaller than I expected given the area and cost of the hotel, but it was very clean. You could tell that its a renovated older space. Nice flat screen tv with lots of channels and dvd "borrowing" is available for no extra cost. The personal products (soap, shampoo, etc.) were high quality and so was the bed. They have a nice workout room and balcony outside of it with good views where you can escape for a while. They have free Wi-Fi but it can be spotty at times. My only "complaint" would be the restaurant. I ordered a tuna carpaccio dish and a hamburger with a beer and it cost (with tip) $70. That's outrageous given the other restaurants in the area, but now I know.

Reviews.Title: “nice location. fun details. super small room.”
Reviews.Author: lisa1424
Reviews.Content: Liked the hotel, but thought the rooms were a little small for the money. Creative details made up for this - I had a black fish as a hotel pet, the noise canceller worked fine for me and I really enjoyed breakfast in the lobby. Concierge had great information for me and I liked the bar character of the lobby at night. Staff at reception was incredibly nice and thoughtful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jimvic
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Soho Grand for 7 nights on business recently. In general I found the hotel to be very good. Location is fab with lots of bars and restaurants nearby. My room was very spacious as I was given a corner spot on the 14th floor which had a lovely view over the city. The bed is extremely comfortable and I slept very well during my stay! Free Wifi is excellent and I was given a login and password at check in. Staff were very friendly and helpful, my only problems being when I asked for a DVD list / DVDs to be sent up I never got them, I also had an issue with ordering room service and no cutlery arriving with it - by the time it did arrive my food was cold but this was removed from my bill with no issues. The lounge bar and breakfast are very good with staff very helpful so if you are at the hotel on business the lounge bar is a good location for meetings. All in all a very good stay and I will return to the hotel. If you are going to stay here be aware that the hotel has a loyalty scheme which I only found out about after my stay as it wasnt highlighted to me at check in - unfortunately the hotel are not willing to give points afterward which is a shame as for 7 nights am guessing this would be quite valuable - so make sure you join on line before!!

Reviews.Title: “Always stay here when I go with my Teenagers to NYC”
Reviews.Author: sabisf
Reviews.Content: Love this hotel. The location is perfect for when I go with my teenage girls. One block form canal street (which they always have to go) and one block from all the trendy shops and restaurants. They have a nice, lively bar in the lobby serves great drinks and some nice h'orderves. The rooms are nice but could use a update, especially for the price you pay. Overall very nice.

Reviews.Title: “THE place to stay in NYC”
Reviews.Author: lucky13London
Reviews.Content: I've always loved New York, as a visitor and at times a brief resident when work has taken me to that part of the world. Whilst you're spoiled for choice in Manhattan, whenever I go back I always head straight for The Soho Grand. The grand interior is everything you'd dream it should feel like - and very elegant/opulant. Compared with many New York hotels, the rooms here are reasonable in price, and far larger in space. The hotel team are warm and helpful. The bar's a place to be in Soho, so always has a pleasing buzz. Meanwhile, the location couldn't be better. You've got everything you'd want on your doorstep, and it's in the best area to explore. One of the things I've always liked about the grand is that it's a place you can use to live in.. awake, breakfast's just as good in the cafe on the corner as it is in the room. You can walk 5-mins to some great shopping or galleries. The hotel bar's as convenient as the great ones locally. You're not always wanting/needing to head 20 mins down the road as all the great places are on your doorstep. Before staying here I've also rented apartments for long weekends, stayed in the 'W', The Paramount, Hudson and a few others.... but now, I just head for The Grand Go there soon, you'll love it.

Reviews.Title: “Hip & Exciting; Comfortable & Relaxing at the same time!”
Reviews.Author: jules2323
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Soho Grand greatly exceeded my expectations. I moved from New York 2 years ago and remember the Soho Grand when it opened years ago! I was pleasantly surprised to see how wll the property has been maintained. I loved my room and the bed was delicious! For being in such a bustling part of town (phenomenal location), the rooms are extremely quiet. I was traveling for business but had time for fun too. The lobby bar & The Park (outdoor bar) are both fun and hip. I ordered room service twice- the food was excellent and the service-prompt. Finally, the staff could not have been friendlier. They were always wiling to help. It was a pleasure to be greeted by the bellman as I came left each day---I miss them!

Reviews.Title: “Will never leave my dog unattended in that hotel again”
Reviews.Author: sunday91
Reviews.Content: The hotel is trendy and fairly nice. Rooms are small to be expected. The "pet friendly" aspect was appealing to me as I had my small terrier with me. I had to leave him in the room several hours Saturday night and was shocked to return to my room and find him nowhere to be seen. He is an older dog so my first thought was that he had fallen ill in a corner of the room. After thoroughly searching the room I thought to call the front desk. The concierge informed me that due to noise complaints, the dog had been taken to the hotel's "dog compound." I can understand how the hotel is responsible for the happiness of all of its guests and a barking dog is certainly a nuisance, but what I can't fathom is that I was not at any point called to be made aware of the situation. The very least the staff could have done would have been to leave a note explaining the disappearance of my dog.

Reviews.Title: “nice place for a cocktail no recommended for the accomodation”
Reviews.Author: samluna
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 days early june and I found the price excessive for the room I got. Close to the bar, noisy, small, not a nice view. Smell of smoking. The 2nd day I finally got another room. This time higher floor, lighter but no safebox. Concierge staff very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Cool Vibe”
Reviews.Author: Happy_TravelerMPLS
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Soho Grand several times for business and I will stay here again next time I plan to stay in Soho. The location is perfect, close to many interesting shops, restaurants, and galleries in Soho - all within easy walking distance. The service at the hotel is stellar and I've never had any issues with attitude or promptness with any requests that I've had. The rooms are small, but I've stayed in many hotels in New York and I would say the size of the rooms are average for the location. The rooms supply a robe, slippers, and mini bar and the beds are very comfortable. I recommend having a meal or cocktail in the restaurant. The atmosphere is very hip, the food is fair, and many locals come to this hotel restaurant which speaks to the special vibe of the hotel. I enjoy staying in SOHO since it is a little more relaxed and less commercial than mid town. If you want to be where all the touristy action is then I would recommend staying in one of the mid town hotels by Time Square.

Reviews.Title: “"hello does anybody work here"”
Reviews.Author: Matthe7788
Reviews.Content: Apon walking uP to the front door 2 gentlemen open the doors for us, nice except 3 steps later you have to open your own 2nd set of doors to get in, odd. Apon walking in there's what appears to be a checkin desk on the left. We stood there for 5 mins alone finally went outside to ask the door guy where the desk person was and he said "oh checkins on the 2nd floor"' You'd think they'd tell new guest with bags in their hands this. Finally really ugly and old rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Understated sophistication with stunning views and great service”
Reviews.Author: LondonOaf
Reviews.Content: As a seasoned traveler to NYC I have always wanted to stay at the Soho Grand, which I finally got around to this week, and it did not disappoint. On the BA flight over I read in the in flight mag that Henry Holland is a fan of the hotel for its understated sophistication which appeals to Brits - and I could not agree more. This is a hotel that doesn't try hard, it is effortlessly chic. Ideally located in bustling Soho, the hotel is perfectly placed for local restaurants, shops and bars yet manages to remain an oasis of calm in an otherwise busy area. I was very impressed with how quiet the rooms are, completed with a very high but comfy bed. The hotel also provides free WiFI which makes all the difference when you're on business, with quick connections. Views from the rooms are incredible, request an Empire State view if you can - it doesn't get much better than this to take in NYC. I didn't get around to eating here, except for breakfast which was lovely, if not a little costly. The hotel itself is full of beautiful people - not just guests, but the staff too. But don't be put off, they are all very welcoming and this is far from an intimidating crowd.

Reviews.Title: “Never experienced such rude and aggressive customer service in 12yrs of business travel”
Reviews.Author: sammielc
Reviews.Content: Awful customer service, very rude and aggressive. Staff are not trained to deal with issues in a fair and responsive way. If I had not paid in advance, I would have left this hotel on the first night, and will not spend anything in the hotel to add to their profits. I have been travelling for 12yrs on business and never experience anything like this service when spending $2000 with a company. The hotel room is nicely addressed, however has extremely high traffic noise. The benefits they promote on the website like products (half empty), pet goldfish (none), wifi doesnt allow you to connect multiple devices. The room does have a strange smell. The hotel itself reminds me of a soulless night club. If you like the style of the W stay at the W not this hotel. British travellers also be aware they charge $150 per night for incidentals, for a long trip, I am spending 5 nights, they wanted to take $750 out of my account. The room has all been paid for in advance. I pointed out this was excessive for incidentals when I am here on business, they became very aggressive to the point of bringing me to tears by treating me like a criminal removing my mini bar.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible rooms, rude people, great location”
Reviews.Author: candaceblattner
Reviews.Content: The overall lobby and decor look great when you arrive. The rooms were horrible and when we arrived at our first room it had a horrible smell of sewage. They were pleasant and switched our room for a new one and we received two complimentary glasses of champagne. On the third day, we woke up to a horrible smell of sewage again. They had maintenance come to our room and flushed something through the pipes, the smell soon dispersed. They took $100 off of our bill but the staff when we were leaving was entirely rude. The hotel is in a great location but the rooms need some TLC!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, good location.. time to revamp the rooms”
Reviews.Author: Journeyman-Saffa
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel in the lower soho area of NYC - close to everywhere on west broadway. Service is always top notch, what you'd expect in NY. Great bar and restaurant.. very funky and hip. One thing they need to get is a fitness centre, even if a small one and the rooms, once cool I'm sure.. are in need of an upgrade... the bathrooms in particular.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff, great value, tired hotel”
Reviews.Author: BenNicholls
Reviews.Content: We arrived to be greeted by VERY friendly and attentive staff. We were advised we were being upgraded to an Exec Room, we were told it was the 2nd best level of room in the hotel. When we got to the room I was relieved to be upgraded, and was very worried to think what the other rooms were like.... Suffice to say the roms are in dire need of an update.... The friendly staff and surrounding area more than made up for the tired room however. We had a good stay and I left feeling it was very good value. A word of warning, if you do need to go anywhere outside of the Soho area, allow more time than you think, the traffic around Soho is TERRIBLE!

Reviews.Title: “Still a great place to stay, Time to renovate”
Reviews.Author: tailstix
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here periodically over the last five or so years. Location and staff are still great. My only issue with my most recent trip was the fact that the place is beginning to feel a bit run down.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Weekend at Soho Grand”
Reviews.Author: newyorker1975
Reviews.Content: We had an amazing stay at the Soho Grand. I live in Manhattan, but surprised my girlfriend with a weekend at Soho Grand in order to propose. There are so many excellent hotels in NYC to choose from, but we loved it. Great location with lots of restaurants and shopping nearby. The hotel felt trendy and comfortable at the same time. The service was excellent from doorman and front desk, to guest services and housekeeping. Free Wifi and excellent room service. Also, we took advantage of the weekend package offered on the website and received an excellent rate. Will stay again and recommend it to my friends!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and clean yet not outstanding. Trying to be trendy but just a bit dull.”
Reviews.Author: Maast
Reviews.Content: Ok location, however the overall hotel is a rather dark (rooms included) and really lacking a cozy and welcoming look&feel. Trying to be trendy but not achieving it really. Not a bad hotel at all, but without any specific charm or appeal, would not recommend if you're a picky hotel user. A bit pricey for what it has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “A refreshing change from the big corporate hotels”
Reviews.Author: FoxtrotOscar
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business visiting a client on Wall Street. Service was very pleasant indeed. The room was perfectly acceptable - didn't seem overly small as noted in some other reviews. Concierge and door staff were particularly helpful and friendly. The bar scene was good too - not too overcrowded, but lively and interesting. Strongly recommended for a bit of peace and quiet in this otherwise mad city!

Reviews.Title: “minimal, hip, delightful!”
Reviews.Author: jmarshon
Reviews.Content: great location, wonderful hotel... close to great restaurants... can get taxi anywhere... a very trendy fun hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: HannahCDubai
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Soho Grand for just over a week in December 2008-January 2009 and had an amazing time. The service at check-in and throughout the stay was friendly and straightforward - there were a couple of minor glitches (dvd player in our room didn't work at first, and our reservation for NYE in the hotel bar/restaurant was temporarily "lost" at about 5pm on 31st December) - but both were sorted out quickly so they didn't become an issue. And there were plenty of nice touches - like glasses of champagne at check-in and a lovely black goldfish in our room. The hotel is very stylish, especially the grand reception area and very cool bar/restaurant. The rooms are a really decent size and well laid out with plenty of wardrobe space - which was good for us as we were there for a reasonably long stay and arrived in New York after a week with family for Xmas, so had a lot of luggage. The bathroom was also a decent size - no larger than necessary but enough room so that it didn't feel cramped, and with great toiletries. The only thing I would really change about the rooms is to have tea & coffee makng stuff in the room. There is a tea/coffee machine on each floor, but that means if you want a cup of coffee when you wake up you need to schlep down the corridor to get it which is a bit of a pain. The hotel is in a great location, with all the great restaurants and bars of SoHo on its doorstep and close to several subway stations if you're heading a bit further afield. The hotel bar/restaurant is great for pre-dinner drinks and a relaxed meal, but probably not the best place if you want a full 3 course meal (atmosphere probably a bit too relaxed for that). It's popular with non-guests too. We celebrated NYE there and they put on a great evening for a pretty reasonable price. All in all, the hotel was a brilliant base for us to explore New York for 10 days - ok so it's not cheap, but I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, great location, good atmosphere!”
Reviews.Author: EstebanBelgrado
Reviews.Content: I liked the atmosphere in this hotel. Much different then midtown hotels I saw before. Room was quite big for NY. Stuff was OK but not extremely friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great doormen and location . . .”
Reviews.Author: mleleanor
Reviews.Content: Fun weekend there with friends. Rooms are SMALL as are bathrooms - but, hey, this is NYC. Doormen are fabulous. Concierges a little too snooty for their ages. Can I say this agan? - doormen- fabulous. And a great deli across street for early am coffee. Room service is FAST. But the hotel needs coffee out in am (but, deli across street, as above). Hotel bar is fun early evening but too crowded late and service is waaaay to slow at lunch.

Reviews.Title: “Talking about service, they still have a heavy work to do right there”
Reviews.Author: jackiejackuk
Reviews.Content: We spent only two nights there. The hotel is alright. But service was so poor... They will have to work very hard on this matter.

Reviews.Title: “Yet again a wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: L37
Reviews.Content: This is the 4th or 5th time I have stayed at the hotel since it opened in 1999. It has been a wonderful experience on every single occasion. The hotel for me, has just the right mix of informality and attentive service. All of the staff made us feel welcome. The concierges did their best with all our requests, both before and during our stay. The lounge staff were very helpful and knowledgable and the room and associated amenities were spot on.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but beware the waitresses with 'attitude'”
Reviews.Author: Oxford_travels
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the SoHo Grand for 3 nights. The hotel is well located for both downtown and midtown and various subway lines are close by. Overall the hotel lived up to expectations and we had a good stay. Just a couple of things which caused us some annoyance. Despite booking a deluxe king room which was advertised as being on the 8th floor or above, they tried to give us a room on the 4th floor with no reduction. After an hours wait in the bar they sorted out a room on the 16th floor which was fine. On the Saturday evening we bought a bottle of wine at the bar and then went to sit at a table (unreserved). After a few minutes a waitress came over and demanded to know where we had got the bottle of wine from, even though the bar was only six feet away. She then told us that all tables were reserved 'by the host' and we would have to move. Pointing out that we were in fact residents and had bought the bottle of wine ($58) from the bar made no difference. We stood at the bar and drunk our bottle whilst watching other people being subjected to the same attitude if they dared to sit down.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: snutch
Reviews.Content: The actual hotel is great, however, we left a phone while we changing rooms due to it being very very noisy outside - the hotel kindly changed us to a room on the other side of the hotel which was a lot quieter. The phone was left charging for 5 minutes and when we called the hotel to get the phone they didn't call us back for a few hours then it was missing. Obviously stolen. The hotel have denied that it was stolen and have only reimbursed us the sum of the phone. This is my partners work phone and he lost a great deal of business from having the phone stolen. This matter was very poorly managed by the hotel and the customer service and chasing up of the matter was not what we expected from a hotel of this calibre.

Reviews.Title: “Gone to the Dogs”
Reviews.Author: gallafi
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Soho Grand for approximately 6-years but after my last visit I won't be going back. Although the lobby bar and restaurant are great, and most of the staff are wonderful, my last experience was so disturbing I can't risk going back! Unfortunately my room, in particular the bed linen, was so dirty that it was a health hazzard.. The duvet was stained, and when I reached for the bed-side phone to call for help, I encountered an incredibly filthy bedside table. All-in-all a very disgusting experience and the hotel is definitely not to be recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location -- but...”
Reviews.Author: Boittito
Reviews.Content: If you want to enjoy Soho, great location. Rooms are very small. Price is high. And am coming off of two service flubs. First -- while tv is not the main thing, while on business I need to catch up on the news, and the cable wasn't working in my room. Front desk said they would send someone up. After 40 minutes, nobody came, so I gave up and went to bed. Then in the morning, had an early train to catch. Breakfast was supposed to be served at 6 a.m. Went down there at 6:15 a.m. and no waiters on hand. One of the busboys offered to give me some coffee while I waited. It was cold. Had time concerns and finally gave up. When I checked out at 7 -- looked very nice, but by then, I needed to go catch a train. It's sometimes the smaller things that convince a customer not to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Getting a little rough around the edges”
Reviews.Author: TripGoat
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in this hotel alot over the years and have mixed service each time. I love the lobby and you can't beat the location, but the rooms have become a little grubby, and the service is often lazy and snooty. I've started to stay at 60 Thompson and Thompson LES instead. These hotels have less character, but the staff are much friendlier.

Reviews.Title: “It's my favourite in New York”
Reviews.Author: LombardiV
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 5 day business trip in New York and London. The Soho Grand is just GRAND on a cool street with SO helpful staff. If you like the Soho, Wall Street and bohemian life in the village it’s the only place to stay - although not cheap worth every dollar As a grand guest you even get a gold fish for company!. The bar buzzes in the evening and the rooms are great. Get one with a city view!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and stylish”
Reviews.Author: GunknGingy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I noticed alot of reviews stating that the staff was rude or complacent. I was expecting a "too cool for you, wannabee uptown attitude". Everyone I spoke with was very pleasant, helpful and gracious that was working in the hotel. We loved the location and the decor was very nice. Great atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: EugenStockholm
Reviews.Content: Really good hotel, location, staff, food etc. Only concern i have is the ugly carpet on the floors outside hotelroom in doorhall, the rom is not luxury rooms, but they are ok.

Reviews.Title: “Love The Soho Grand”
Reviews.Author: jmaletych
Reviews.Content: Okay, from the moment you walk in the door you know you have made the right choice. The hotel is ultra hip and the staff was fabulous. We travel a lot and we were not expecting how cool this hotel actually is. We started our night out in the city early and came back after dinner and chilled in the lounge until 2:00am. The music was SO great and we had so much fun in the lounge that we actually left the lounge when it was closed and went dancing until 5:30am! We had a great time at Soho Grand. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it”
Reviews.Author: judyrita
Reviews.Content: Location great - Staff very helpful - Quiet (there was a wedding in the hotel that night) Clean Comfortable Can't wait to go back

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the Tribeca Grand instead”
Reviews.Author: Paddy31London
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a location and is really cool place, however the attitude of some of the staff is a disgrace. The lounge seats are often reserved and so after a busy day, if you want to sit and chill for a bit you often cant, and to make it worse when you ask the staff in the lounge they look at you as though you just spat in their face. I have previously stayed in the Tribeca Grand, their sister hotel, which has been fantastic. It is only a few minutes walk away to the south. Stay there instead.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Mussla
Reviews.Content: Everything you need: comfort, clean, high tech and good location

Reviews.Title: “What a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: TriCoastal
Reviews.Content: Yes, it's got a hip reputation, but it's glory days are clearly over: 1.Reported light broken upon check in. Five nights later, it still wasn't fixed. 2.Bfast service in restaurant was GLACIAL. Plus they have the nerve to automatically add 20% tip for a single diner. In the restaurant, not room service! 3.Newspaper finally showed up 3 mornings in to my stay. 4.Only one window (of 2) in room would open. 5.picture on TV was awful 6.no a/c in the hallways 7. a/c unit in room sounded ancient--very noisy. 8.single stairmaster in the gym is clunky/has seen better days. I stayed here because it's so close to my office but for these rates there are much better options in the area, including a simple Hamptons Inn and Hilton Garden Inn, both of which are brand new.

Reviews.Title: “Love Soho and The Soho Grand”
Reviews.Author: 4Horseman
Reviews.Content: This place is great. Perfect location if you are driving from the south as it is 2 minutes from the Holland tunnell. The whole place has a very casual vibe and the staff is very nice. The bar is also very nice and surprisingly quiet. Every time we stay there we feel like we are the only guests there even when it's full. This is the only place to stay in my opinion. Not super fancy but right on.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Beat the Location”
Reviews.Author: kmh200886
Reviews.Content: We arrived on a redeye at 7 a.m. and were immediately allowed to check in to our room (no waiting 'till 3 pm) - that's service. Doormen were always very friendly. One of the bellguy's gave us some good recommendations about nearby bars to check out. Room, of course, was tiny, but that is a given. The first night the sheets smelled of smoke, but that seemed to go away (maybe we just got used to it). There was a slight musty smell to the room and bathroom, but it didn't bother us too much. Bathroom counter space is non-existent and it is definitely a chore for two people to try to get ready at the same time. Also, ladies, beware: the lighting is horrible for doing makeup. They might consider installing some high quality lighted mirrors. We did not eat at the hotel or visit the bar -- too many other places to see! Can't beat the location - which is really what you are paying for. Wifi is spotty.
